title: the_star_wars_holiday_special
body:
An infamous 1978 Holiday TV special centered around [[Star Wars]] with the original actors of the first movie. 

Panned by audiences and critics alike as a cheap "cash-grab" to sell more toys and other products given its low production values when compared to [[star_wars:_a_new_hope|the previous film]].

title: core_booster
body:
A fictional heavy [[starfighter]] from [[Gundam]]. It first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] anime TV series from 1979.

It is basically a [[Core Fighter]] attached to a space booster unit that greatly increases itrs speed and range.

title: stasis_tank
body:
A liquid-filled [[container]] (usually a [[tube]] or a tank) with [[transparent]] walls. Possible uses include keeping living organisms in [b]stasis[/b], accelerating growth or development after undergoing a [[clone|cloning]] process, or even post-injury healing and recovery.

An archetypal stasis tank design can be seen in post #607235. [[Science fiction]] commonly depicts people floating in these tanks, such as shown in post #80217. 

(Note that this tag can apply to a wide variety of containers/vats/tanks, as long as have a description and function similar to what is outlined above.)

h4. See also

* [[Cryostasis pod]]
* [[Vat]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Stasis (fiction)":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stasis_%28fiction%29]

title: cryostasis_pod
body:
A piece of technology seen in some [[science_fiction|sci-fi]] works. Essentially, a cryostasis pod is a specialized [[freezer]] intended for use with human bodies. The intent is for the occupant to go into a state of suspended animation until they can be thawed out unharmed at a later date.

h4. See also

* [[Stasis tank]]

title: imsa_sportscar_championship
body:
A [[racecar|motorsport]] series officiated by "IMSA":[https://www.imsa.com/], formed in 2014 after a merger between the [[American Le Mans Series]] and the [[Grand-Am Road racing|Grand-Am Sports Car Championship]]. As of 2016 the title sponsor is WeatherTech, making it's current official name the [b]IMSA Weathertech SportsCar Championship[/b].

The series consists of endurance and sprint races, including the prestigious [[daytona international speedway|Rolex 24 Hours at Daytona]] and the [[sebring international raceway|12 Hours of Sebring]]. The grid consists of multiple [[le mans prototype|prototype classes]] (GTP & LMP2), as well as GT3 cars separated into 2 classes based on driver lineup (GTD-Pro & GTD). DPi and LMP3-spec prototypes, and GTE-spec sports cars previously competed in this series, but were retired between the 2021-2023 seasons.

title: theodolite
body:
A theodolite is a precision optical instrument for measuring angles between designated visible points in the horizontal and vertical planes. It is used for land surveying, building and infrastructure construction, and specialized applications such as meteorology and rocket launching.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Theodolite":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theodolite]

title: claire_elford
body:
The main character of [[Witch's Heart]] - a cheerful, carefree and kindhearted young woman who arrives at the mansion solely to escape the rain before realizing she has some connections to it. She loves cute, pretty, and girly things, and has been a big fan of the "Witch’s Heart" storybooks ever since she was a child. Though she’s a bit of an airhead, she is shown to be a very capable fighter when it comes to handling and battling demons using her powerful kicks.

She is bound to [[zizel_(witch's_heart)|Zizel]] via a demonic pact signed by a third party, and her original goal after being trapped in the mansion is to find the contract to end it. Thanks to Zizel, she can see and interact with high-ranking demons.

title: flyer_(titanfall)
body:
Flying, dragon-like reptilian [[creature]]s found on multiple worlds in the [[Titanfall (series)|]] universe, noted to be around the same size as a [[Titan (titanfall)|]]. In the Titanfall games they appear as environmental creatures in several maps of the first game, and in certain campaign missions in the sequel.

Flyers also appear in [[Apex Legends]], where they fly around [[Kings Canyon]] and [[Storm Point (apex legends)|]] carrying [[death box (apex legends)|]]es with randomized contents. Players can shoot them to make them drop the boxes.

title: manaka_laala
body:
Protagonist of  [i][[Pripara]][/i].

Lala has [[short hair|short]] [[light purple hair]] with [[double bun|double buns]], [[ahoge]] and [[aqua eyes]]. She wears a [[pink bow|pink]] [[hair bow]] and is usually seen in [[Paprika Private Academy school uniform]].

When in PriPara form, Lala obtains [[very long hair|very long]] [[twintails]]. Her default costume in PriPara includes a [[detached collar|detached]] [[white collar]], a [[short dress|short]] [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[multicolored dress]] with [[white sleeves|white]] [[puffy detached sleeves]], [[treble clef]] accessory, [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[layered skirt]], [[coattails]] and a [[waist bow]]. On her legs, she wears [[frilled thighhighs|frilled]] [[white thighhighs]] and [[pink footwear|pink]] [[shoes]] with [[high heels]].

title: mega_man_x_dive
body:
Mega Man X DiVE is a mobile platform game from the [[Mega Man X (series)|]] series released on March 2020.

The game follows the story of the Player and a navigator of the "Deep Log", [[RiCO (mega man)|]]. Deep Log is where the game data of the Player are stored as well as the data of the beloved game series Mega Man X.

The Player works alongside RiCO to fix the anomalies that happened within the Deep Log that is causing the corruption of the Mega Man X games, causing the data of various games within and outside of the X series to get mingled together.

h4. New characters
* [[RiCO (mega man)|]]
* [[ViA (mega man)|]]
* [[iCO (megaman x dive)|]]
* [[Droitclair]]
* [[Eratoeir (mega man x dive)|]]
* [[Angepitoyeir]]

title: milli_vanilli
body:
[b]Milli Vanilli[/b] was an European R&B duo composed of Frenchman Fab Morvan and German Rob Pilatus(8 June 1964 or 1965 – 3 April 1998) who gain popularity during 1989-1990 for their hit songs but gain controversy when it was discovered the duo didn't sing their songs but we're lip syncing as the actual singers were hired by their music producer, Frank Farian.

While the duo was mocked for their lip syncing and lying to their fans in the past, today many sympathize with the duo when it was revealed Farian never intended to have Fab and Rob sing their songs and the duo were forced to lie due to signing a binding contract with Farian.

title: spring_rider
body:
A common [[playground]] fixture with a seat and handlebars, usually shaped like some sort of animal. It is mounted on a [[spring_(object)|]] so that it bounces and wobbles when ridden.

h4.See also

* [[Carousel]]
* [[Kiddie ride]]
* [[Rocking horse]]

h4.External links

* "Wikipedia: Spring rider":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spring_rider]

title: kerberos_(mementomori)
other_names: ケルベロス(メメントモリ)

title: young_blood_bloodhound
body:
A [[official alternate costume|Legendary]] skin for [[Bloodhound (apex legends)|]] in [[Apex Legends]], released as part of Season 4's The Old Ways event. This skin is based on Bloodhound's younger appearance in their Stories from the Outlands short, "The Old Ways":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dCXOnxM8sdY].

In this appearance Bloodhound wears a [[blue shirt]] with [[black pants]] and [[brown gloves]], and their face is obscured by a combination of [[goggles]], a [[rebreather]], a [[brown headwear|brown]] [[aviator cap]], and an [[animal skull]] worn as a helmet.

title: the_intimidator_bloodhound
body: A [[official alternate costume|Legendary]] skin for [[Bloodhound (apex legends)|]] in [[Apex Legends]], previously available exclusively as part of the "Bloodhound Edition" purchase bundle.

title: road_warrior_bloodhound
body: A [[official alternate costume|Legendary]] skin for [[Bloodhound (apex legends)|]] in [[Apex Legends]], released as part of Season 6's battle pass. This skin is a [[streetwear]]-inspired appearance with prominent writing on Bloodhound's clothes, and a skull-styled [[mask]].

title: sundown_desperado_bloodhound
body: A [[official alternate costume|legendary skin]] for [[Bloodhound (apex legends)|]] in [[Apex Legends]], released as part of a collaboration with the fashion brand "Market":[https://marketstudios.com/]. In this appearance  Bloodhound wears a [[black headwear|black]] [[cowboy hat]], a [[gas mask]], and features [[flame print]] on their clothes.

title: snow_prints_bloodhound
body: A [[official alternate costume|Legendary]] skin for [[Bloodhound (apex legends)|]] exclusively in [[Apex Legends Mobile]]. This skin gives Bloodhound a winter-styled appearance with a white color scheme.

title: blue_dragon_bloodhound
body: An [[official alternate costume|Eternal]] skin for [[Bloodhound (apex legends)|]] exclusively in [[Apex Legends Mobile]]. This skin gives Bloodhound a suit of futuristic [[power armor]] in a blue color scheme.

title: wicked_harvest_bloodhound
body: A [[official alternate costume|Legendary]] skin for [[Bloodhound (apex legends)|]] in [[Apex Legends]], released as part of Season 6's Fight or Fright event. This skin is a [[Halloween]] appearance where Bloodhound wears a white [[jack-o'-lantern]] on their head, with a [[red headwear|red]] [[witch hat]] and [[red jacket]].

title: protector_of_the_patch_bloodhound
body: A [[official alternate costume|Legendary]] skin for [[Bloodhound (apex legends)|]] in [[Apex Legends]], released as part of Season 3's Fight or Fright event. This skin is a [[Halloween]] appearance where Bloodhound wears a [[jack-o'-lantern]] on their head, with a [[blue headwear|blue]] [[witch hat]] and [[blue jacket]].

title: raven's_shadow_bloodhound
body: A [[official alternate costume|Legendary]] skin for [[Bloodhound (apex legends)|]] in [[Apex Legends]], which prominently features a [[plague doctor]] mask in an orange color scheme.

title: wise_warrior_bloodhound
body: A [[official alternate costume|Legendary]] skin for [[Bloodhound (apex legends)|]] in [[Apex Legends]], released as part of Season 4's The Old Ways event. Features an owl-styled [[helmet]] with a [[cuirass]] in a black color scheme.

title: hunter's_moon_bloodhound
body: A [[official alternate costume|Legendary]] skin for [[Bloodhound (apex legends)|]] in [[Apex Legends]], released as part of Season 8's Anniversary event. Features an owl-styled [[helmet]] with a [[cuirass]] in a red color scheme.

title: luca_(minase_rio)
body: [[Minase Rio]]'s pet [[cat]].

title: flute72
body: For the artist formerly tagged here, see [[Azuma Hatori]].

title: vanillaware
body:
Vanillaware (ヴァニラウェア有限会社) is a Japanese video game company development studio. Previously, they were known as Puraguru from 2002 until 2004, when they renamed as Vanillaware. The studio's past projects have specialized in 2D, or sprite-based, game design.

title: mario_(tuxedo)
body: An official alternate costume for [[Mario]] introduced in [[Super Mario Odyssey]]. Depicts him as a complete [[groom]], complete with a full [[white suit]] with an [[open jacket]] and [[coattails]], exposing a [[white vest|white]] [[striped vest]] with [[buttons]] and a [[traditional bowtie|traditional]] [[red bowtie]]. Also wears a [[white hat|white]] [[top hat]] and a [[white footwear|white version]] of his usual [[shoes]].

title: mario_(sunshine)
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Mario]] introduced in [[Super Mario Sunshine]]. Depicted wearing an [[open shirt|open]] [[blue shirt|blue]] [[collared shirt]] with [[short sleeves]] and a [[shine sprite]] print on it over his usual clothes barring sleeves. Also seen with a pair of [[blue-framed eyewear|blue-framed]] [[sunglasses]].

title: mario_(santa)
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Mario]] introduced in [[Mario Kart Tour]]. Puts him in the typical [[Santa costume]], complete with a [[fake beard]] and a [[sack]], and is often seen holding a [[gift]].

title: mario_(halloween)
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Mario]] found on some [[Halloween]] [[official art]] and in [[Mario Kart Tour]]. Depicts him wearing a [[pumpkin hat]] resembling a [[jack-o'-lantern]] and a [[purple cape]], along with a notable pair of [[fangs]].

title: mario_(hakama)
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Mario]] introduced in [[Mario Kart Tour]]. Depicted wearing a [[black robe|black]] [[haori]] over a [[red shirt]] and [[grey hakama]], complete with [[tabi]], [[yellow footwear|yellow]] [[sandals]], and his usual [[white gloves]]. Notably, Mario doesn't wear a hat at all.

title: kanon_maru
body: Namesake original character of "@kanon_maru":[https://x.com/kanon_maru_?s=21] (??)

title: mario_(golf)
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Mario]] originally seen in [[NES Open Tournament Golf]] but reintroduced in [[Mario Kart Tour]]. Depicted as wearing a [[striped headwear|striped]] [[red hat|red]] [[two-tone headwear|and]] [[white hat|white]] [[baseball cap]] with matching [[overalls]] over a [[blue shirt]] with [[long sleeves]] and a [[star print]], as well as his usual [[white gloves]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]]. Often seen holding a [[golf club]].

title: builder_mario
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Mario]] seen in the [[Super Mario Maker]] games. Depicted wearing a [[red overalls|red version]] of his usual [[overalls]] and a [[yellow shirt]] instead of a red one, along with a [[brown belt]] complete with a [[brown bag|brown]] [[belt bag]] and a [[yellow hat|yellow]] [[hard hat]]. Often seen holding a [[hammer]].

title: tennis_mario
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Mario]] throughout the [[Mario Tennis]] series. Depicted wearing a [[red shirt]] with [[short sleeves]], [[buttons]], and a [[white collar]] along with [[white shorts]], [[blue socks]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[sneakers]]. Also wears a [[red hat|red]] [[visor cap]] and his usual [[white gloves]].

title: raccoon_costume
body: A type of animal costume modeled after a [[raccoon]].

title: shell_mario
body: What you get when [[Mario]] wears a [[blue shell (mario)|Blue Shell]].

title: propeller_mario
body: An alternate form [[Mario]] takes on when using the [[propeller mushroom]]. When in this form, he wears a [[red jumpsuit]] with a [[red belt]], and his usual [[shoes]] become [[blue footwear|blue]]. His hat also becomes a [[helmet]], with a [[propeller]] on top.

title: penguin_mario
body: An alternate form [[Mario]] takes on when using the penguin suit. In this form, he wears a [[penguin costume]] complete with a [[blue hood]] and [[flippers]], and has on a pair of [[red overalls]] over it.

title: mini_mario
body: An alternate form [[Mario]] takes on when using the [[mini mushroom]]. In this form, he becomes effectively a [[miniboy]].

title: frog_mario
body: An alternate form of [[Mario]] when using the frog suit. In this form, Mario wears a [[frog costume]] complete with a [[green hood|green]] [[frog hood]] and webbed feet.

title: flying_squirrel_mario
body: An alternate form [[Mario]] takes on when using the [[super acorn]]. In this form, his [[overalls]] become [[red]] and his shirt becomes [[grey shirt|grey]] and has a notable [[turtleneck shirt|turtleneck]] to it. His usual hat also gains a pair of [[fake animal ears|fake]] [[squirrel ears]] and he also has a [[fake tail|fake]] [[squirrel tail]], as well as a membrane between his arms and his back reminiscent of real world flying squirrels. His shoes also become [[grey footwear|grey]], similar to his shirt.

title: flying_mario
body: An alternate form [[Mario]] takes on when using the [[red star (mario)|red star]]. In this form, his [[overalls]] and [[cabbie hat]] [[grey overalls|become]] [[grey hat|grey]].

title: fire_mario
body: An alternate form [[Mario]] takes on when using the [[fire flower]]. In this form, his [[overalls]] becomes [[red overalls|red]] and his [[shirt]] and [[cabbie hat]] [[white shirt|become]] [[white hat|white]].

title: bilbo_baggins
body: Bilbo Baggins is the title character and protagonist of J. R. R. Tolkien's 1937 novel [[The Hobbit]], a supporting character in [[The Lord of the Rings]], and the fictional narrator (along with [[Frodo Baggins]]) of many of Tolkien's Middle-earth writings

title: tarrasque
body: One of the most infamous and powerful monsters from the [[Dungeons & Dragons]] roleplaying game.  Like other monsters, specifics of its appearance and power vary between versions, but it usually appears as a unique, gigantic bipedal reptilian creature.  It is also immensely strong and tough even for its size, and in some versions, the means to truly kill it are unknown.

title: the_hobbit
body: A prequel to [[The Lord of the Rings]], part of [[Tolkien's Legendarium]].

title: drizzt_do'urden
body:
Drizzt Do'Urden is a [[Dark Elf]] hero of the Forgotten Realms setting of [[Dungeons & Dragons]]. Born in the underground Drow city of Menzoberranzan, Drizzt broke from his race and their worship of the evil goddess and demon queen Lolth, making his way to the surface of Faerun. He has accomplished many great deeds across Faerun, but bears a special hatred for his dark elven kin, and seeks to stop their plans however he can.

Drizzt is most known for his two magical scimitars, Twinkle and Icingdeath, and his panther companion [[Guenhwyvar]].

title: elephant_mario
body: An alternate form [[Mario]] takes on when using the [[elephant fruit]]. In this form, Mario becomes a [[furry male|furry]] [[elephant boy]], complete with [[elephant ears|ears]] and [[elephant tail|tail]]. His sleeves are also noticeably short (though still [[long sleeves|long]]), and he [[barefoot|loses his shoes]].

title: kaleina_(ricegnat)
body: Original character designed by [[RiceGnat]], who roleplays as her in [i][[Dungeons & Dragons]][/i].

title: drill_mario
body: An alternate form [[Mario]] takes on when using the [[drill mushroom]]. In this form, his [[overalls]] become [[red overalls|red]] and his [[shirt]] becomes [[grey shirt|grey]], with his usual hat being replaced by a [[drill]].

title: elemental_(creature)
body:
A broad class of mythological creature associated with the classical Greek elements: [[earth_(element)|earth]], [[water]], air, and [[fire]]. The concept of elementals originated in Renaissance-era European [[alchemy|alchemical]] works but has been popularized in recent decades by [[Dungeons & Dragons]] and related [[fantasy]] settings.

Depictions of elementals vary widely but they tend to be roughly humanoid in appearance, with abilities and personality traits corresponding to their associated elements. For instance, water elementals are adaptable and can flow like liquid, whereas fire elementals are passionate and can burn anything they touch.

Occasionally, elementals may be associated with "elements" other than the usual four. For instance, ice elementals, lightning elementals, or plant elementals.

h4.Elementals in alchemy

* [[gnome]]
* [[undine]]
* [[sylph]]
* [[salamander]]

h4.See also

* [[golem]]
* [[slime girl]]
* [[personification]]
* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]

h4.External links

* "Wikipedia: Elemental":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elemental

A type of sentient [[tree]]-like beings in [[Dungeons & Dragons]], based directly on the [b]Ents[/b] in [[the lord of the rings|J. R. R. Tolkien's]] legendarium. Depictions of treants vary, but they are almost always mobile creatures with a blend of human and tree features.

title: boomerang_mario
body: An alternate form [[Mario]] takes on when using a [[boomerang flower]]. In this form, he wears a blue [[turtle shell]] like that of a [[Boomerang Brothers|Boomerang Brother]] and wears a [[blue hat|blue]] [[helmet]] with a red [[visor cap]] underneath. He also wears [[red pants]] and a [[blue footwear|blue version]] of his normal [[shoes]]. Typically seen wielding a [[boomerang]].

title: mindflayer
body: Also known as illithids. Classic monster from [[Dungeons & Dragons]]. Dangerous humanoid aberrations with squid-like heads and psionic powers, they feed on human brains.

title: beholder
body:
A [[monster]] from [[Dungeons & Dragons]]. A large floating orb with a huge mouth and central eye, as well as a number of smaller eyes on stalks, though deatails beyond that vary.

It has appeared in every edition of D&D since 1975, as well as many other fantasy settings drawing from it.

title: roper
body:
A monster originally from [[Dungeons & Dragons]], but also used in [[druaga no tou|Tower of Druaga]].  

In the original D&D version, they masquerade as trees, and lash out with vines to drag adventurers to their doom.

The Japanese version, however, looks distinctly like a classic "[[tentacles]] monster", and as such, almost invariably appears in Japanese works as such a creature and for tentacle jokes.  

It also appears more recently in some Monster Musume works, such as [[Monster Girl Encyclopedia]], and as an evolution in [[Elona]]. Again, mostly as a tentacle monster reference.

title: shindou_hikari
body: [[Soukou Senki Prism Reica]] and [[Soukou Senki Prism Shine]] character. [[Shindou Hatsune]]'s younger sister.

title: shindou_hatsune
body: [[Soukou Senki Prism Reica]] and [[Soukou Senki Prism Shine]] character. [[Shindou Hikari]]'s older sister.

title: owlbear
body: An owlbear is a creature from [[Dungeons & Dragons]]. An owlbear is best described as a cross between an owl and a bear created by some deranged wizard from ages back, "hugging" and mauling much like a bear and also attacking with its sharp beak.

title: amakubo_kaede
body: [[Kouyoku Senki ExS-Tia]] character. [[Amakubo Yuri]]'s older sister

title: darkmantle
body:
A cave-dwelling monster from [[Dungeons & Dragons]] that resembles a [[vampire squid]] with [[extra eyes|eyes all around the outside of its body]]. Darkmantles have the ability to create shrouds of darkness that blocks most forms of light and prey on other travelers in deep underground locales, including human-sized beings. Darkmantles usually kill by smothering their prey in their webbing.

As darkmantles are listed as open game content, they have appeared in other fantasy TTRPGs (eg. [[Pathfinder]]).

title: kobold
body:
A race of short reptilian humanoids found mostly in Western fantasy settings.

"Kobold" originally refers to a type of small nature sprite from Germanic folklore. [[Dungeons & Dragons]] used the word for a race of small and weak monstrous humanoids. In the early black-and-white artwork, they were ambiguously reptilian and/or doglike. Later editions of D&D clarified them as reptilian and draconic, while most Japanese media interpreted them as [[dog girl|dog]] [[dog boy|people]]. This tag refers to the former.

title: record_of_lodoss_war
body:
("[i]Lodoss-tou Senki[/i]", Lit. "Lodoss Island War Chronicle")

Their first campaign has been adapted into an animated series, [i][[The Legend of Vox Machina]][/i].

title: starlia_lese
body:
A character from [[ragna_crimson|Ragna Crimson]], also known as the Silver Princess.

Born without arms, Starlia is an [[armless_amputee|armless amputee]] that uses [[telekinesis]] to control two [[prosthetic_arm|prosthetic arms]], numerous silverine [[sword|swords]] as her primary means of offense. Her unique [[multicolored_eyes|multicolored eyes]] with [[cross-shaped_pupils|cross-shaped pupils]] allow her to see the silverine aura of living beings.

Often wears a [[white_dress|white]], [[sleeveless_dress|sleeveless]] dress with a [[sash]] around her waist, [[hair_flower|hair flowers]] in her [[purple_hair|purple hair]].

title: dashing_thief_peach
body: One of [[Princess Peach|Princess Peach's]] transformations in [[Princess Peach: Showtime!]], which lets her use [[grappling hook|grappling hooks]] and open locks. In this form, she wears a [[black coat|black]] [[trench coat]] with [[buttons]] and [[long sleeves]], as well as a [[two-sided cape|two-sided]] [[black cape|black]] and [[red cape]] with a [[high collar]]. Her hair becomes a [[single hair bun|single bun]], along with wearing a [[black hat]], a [[black mask|black]] [[eye mask]], [[white gloves]], a [[black pantyhose]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[cross-laced footwear|cross-laced]] [[high heel boots|high heel]] [[knee boots]].

Hosted by [[Mirai Akari]], [[Dennou Shoujo Siro]], [[Nekomiya Hinata]], [[Tsukino Mito]], [[Tanaka Hime]], and [[Suzuki Hina]], referred to collectively as the Virtual Real. Features both reoccurring guests and cameos from fellow VTubers of the time.

title: agrs
body:
Created by [[Sugita Tomokazu]], [b]Automatic Game Revolution System[/b] (pronounced A-JI-RU-SU) originally appeared in 2010 on [[tomokazu_sugita_no_anigera_deduuun|Anigera]] as its mascot and as Sugita's own toy. She originally spoke through the use of pre-recorded voices, and sometimes a male AGRS appeared too. Most illustrations from this period were drawn by Anigera fans imagining their own image of AGRS. Whilst [[Umino Chika]] would illustrate "her":[http://web.archive.org/web/20110326184544/http://ambiseiy.com/2010/08/28/sugita-tomokazu-no-anigera-dedooon-37/] in 2010 for the radio show, by 2015, a proper official image of AGRS began to develop, as she appeared in card form in [[Battle Spirits]].

Later on, Sugita began voicing and embodying AGRS. In late 2018, in collaboration with [[Magatsu Wahrheit]] and [[Dennou Shoujo Siro]], he would both cosplay as AGRS at an official event, and use her as his avatar in virtual reality, appearing live alongside Siro.

Finally, in April of 2020, Sugita departed from Atomic Monkey to establish the independent company AGRS, which among other things, will feature character management, such as AGRS herself. Sugita would post on April 15th his first semi-VTuber video as AGRS, finalizing her design for her quasi-[[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] incarnation.

h4. External links 

* "anokoe (Tumblr) - [RadioSubs] Anigera Compilation #3":[https://anokoe.tumblr.com/post/163631394757/radiosubs-anigera-compilation-3]
* "The Hand That Feeds HQ - Tomokazu Sugita has left Atomic Monkey":[https://handthatfeedshq.com/2020/04/02/tomokazu-sugita-left-atomic-monkey/] 
* "neo-tokyo 2099 - Voice actor Sugita Tomokazu goes independent, establishes new company “AGRS”":[http://neotokyo2099.com/2020/04/01/sugita-tomokazu-goes-independent-establishes-new-company-agrs/] 
* AGRS:
** "Official Website":[https://agrs.co.jp/]
** "Official Twitter":[https://twitter.com/AGRS_staff] 
** "Official YouTube":[https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCbPVSXP89cDlsiMf0jet1zQ]

title: dennou_shoujo_siro
body:
[b]Dennou Shoujo SHIRO[/b] (電脳少女シロ), romanized in Japan as [b]Siro[/b] is a [[Virtual Youtuber]] and aspiring Japanese [[idol]]. She made her YouTube debut on June 28, 2017, making her one of the first VTubers in the world. Her channel features a wide variety of content, including gaming and other popular trends, but also her own musical performances as well. 

She has a demure and feminine personality with a fondness for cats and eating sweets. Despite this, she doesn't hesitate when killing in games, which has contributed to a [[yandere]] personality in some of her videos. Her self-described charm point is her own two [[ahoge]], or [[antenna hair]]. She is sometimes listed as a "Ninja", but this is likely due to an inability to properly translate "Dennou", which would roughly mean "Electric Brain", another term for artificial intelligence.

Fans have taken to calling her a dolphin (イルカ) due to the strange sounds she makes when laughing.

h4. Related tags

* [[.live]]
* [[Sirogumi]] - fans of Siro.
* [[SIROTSUMEKUSA]] - Siro's theatrical debut.

h4. External Links

* YouTube: "Channel Page":[https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLhUvJ_wO9hOvv_yYENu4fQ] | "Self-Introduction":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fLC5TE_KYcw]
* Twitter: "SIROyoutuber":[https://twitter.com/SIROyoutuber]

title: makankousappou
body:
魔貫光殺砲 ([i]Makan Kousappō[/i] - Demonic Piercing Light Killer Cannon) is [[Piccolo]]'s [[energy beam]] attack from his two fingers. Also used by [[Son Gohan]] in his [[Gohan Beast]] form. 
Translated word is "Light of Death" in the comics, or "Special Beam Cannon" in the English dub.

[td]A grunt which one says when they are about to perform a task especially if it's a physical task, and they don't want to do it.  Like "here we go"; see also ヨッコラセ (Yokkorase), アラヨット (Arayotto).[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]doku doku[/td]
[td]ドクドク[/td]
[td]どくどく[/td]
[td]*gushingly* *profusely*[/td]
[td]SFX for gushing, running off (thick liquid).[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dokun[/td]
[td]ドクン[/td]
[td]どくん[/td]
[td](1) *heart thump* *ba-dump* *heartbeat*[/td]
[td](1) A hard heart beat, see also *doki* and *tokun*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dokya-n[/td]
[td]ドキャーン[/td]
[td]どきゃーん[/td]
[td]*surprise* *whoa*[/td]
[td]SFX to express extreme surprise or shock.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dokyun[/td]
[td]ドキュン[/td]
[td]どきゅん[/td]
[td](1) *bang*[/td]
[td](1) Like  a bullet from a gun.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]domu domu[/td]
[td]ドムドム[/td]
[td]どむどむ[/td]
[td]*bounce bounce*[/td]
[td]SFX for the bouncing of a ball, like in basketball.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]don[/td]
[td]ドンッ[/td]
[td]どんっ[/td]
[td](1) *punch*;
(2) *thud* *bam*;
(3) *scared*;
(4) *doom* *scary*
(5) *shove*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for fighting;
(2) SFX for bumping into something or someone;
(4) SFX for a scary scene, used for dramatic or exaggerated effect[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]don[/td]
[td]ドン[/td]
[td]どん[/td]
[td](1) *bang* *boom*; 
(2) *push away*;
(3) *big impact* *blast*;
(4) *astonish* *tada* *ta-da*;
(5) *tap*;
(6) *thump* *bang* *whump*;
(7) *thud*;
(8) *bump*[/td]
[td](4) Sometimes added to a scene for dramatic effect, to show that something astonishing or important has happened, see also *ban*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]don don[/td]
[td]ドンドン[/td]
[td]どんどん[/td]
[td](1) *quickly*
*fast*
*rapidly*;
(2) *more and more*;
(3) *steadily*;
(4) *bang* *beat*[/td]
[td](2) Ex: Attitude growing increasingly worse; Often used as a regular vocabulary word in everyday speech;
(3) Ex: To continue unerringly through a jungle without stopping;
(4) See also *ton ton*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]don don don[/td]
[td]ドンドンドン[/td]
[td]どんどんどん[/td]
[td](1) *knock knock*;
(2) *bam bam bam*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for knocking heavily on a door.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]doo[/td]
[td]ドォ[/td]
[td]どぉ[/td]
[td]*ta-dah* *tada* *da-dah*[/td]
[td]In an annunciative or revealing moment (can be sarcastic and humorous).[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]doon[/td]
[td]ドォォン[/td]
[td]どぉぉん[/td]
[td](1) *doom*;
(2) *boom*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for added drama, usually to emphasize dire circumstances;
(2) SFX for a loud, shattering explosion[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dooon[/td]
[td]ドオオンッ[/td]
[td]どおおんっ[/td]
[td](1) *da-booom* *ka-boom*;
(2) *depressed* *gloom*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for an explosion;
(2) SFX for emotional depression (often exaggerated)[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dooon[/td]
[td]ドオオン[/td]
[td]どおおん[/td]
[td](1) *BAM* *EXPLOSION* * *KABOOM*;
(2) *ba-ba-bam!* *ba bam*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for something with a huge impact, usually something to do with the surrounding environment;
(2) Another SFX for *ta-dah*[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dopyu[/td]
[td]ドピュ[/td]
[td]どぴゅ[/td]
[td](1) *spurt*[/td]
[td](1) Spurting, such as blood.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]doro[/td]
[td]ドロッ[/td]
[td]どろっ[/td]
[td](1) *muddy*; 
(2) *melty* *drip* *glup*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]doro doro[/td]
[td]ドロドロ[/td]
[td]どろどろ[/td]
[td](1) *muddy*; 
(2) *melty*
*ooze ooze*[/td]
[td](2) SFX for something viscous flowing, such as lava flowing.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]doro-n[/td]
[td]ドローン[/td]
[td]どろーん[/td]
[td](1) *sticky* *thick*; 
(2) *doomed* *upset* *gloomy*; 
(3) *gloomy*[/td]
[td](1) Texture; 
(2) When one is very down; 
(3) Haunted house sense.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]doron[/td]
[td]ドロン[/td]
[td]どろん[/td]
[td]*transform*[/td]
[td]Sound of magical transformation, see also *bon*, *pon*, and *pom*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]doronpa[/td]
[td]ドロンパ[/td]
[td]どろんぱ[/td]
[td]*woshka*[/td]
[td]SFX for ghostly, magical transformation, Ex. Doronpa in Obake no Q-taro.
See also *bon*, *pon*, and *pom*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dorun[/td]
[td]ドルン[/td]
[td]どるん[/td]
[td]*vroom* *roar* *rumble*[/td]
[td]SFX for the roar of an engine.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dorya-[/td]
[td]ドリャァー[/td]
[td]どりゃぁー[/td]
[td]*yell*[/td]
[td]A war cry.  See also *ora*, *orya*, *sorya*, and *uraa*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dosa[/td]
[td]ドサッ[/td]
[td]どさっ[/td]
[td](1) *collapse* *fall*;
(2) *thump*[/td]
[td]Collapsing on a bed or sofa in an exhausted manner.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dosa[/td]
[td]ドサ[/td]
[td]どさ[/td]
[td]*flump* *flomp*
*thud* *fwump*[/td]
[td]Usually used when a stack of clothes/paper is put down.
See also *dosha*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dosa dosa[/td]
[td]ドサドサ[/td]
[td]どさどさ[/td]
[td](1) *falling*;
(2) *whump whump*
*thump thump*;
(3) *flap flap*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for falling objects.  See also *dosa*;
(2) SFX for falling objects.  See also *dosa*;
(3) SFX for flailing limbs.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dosan[/td]
[td]ドサン[/td]
[td]どさん[/td]
[td]*THUD*
*FWUMP*
*BAM!*[/td]
[td]See also *dosa*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dosha[/td]
[td]ドシャ[/td]
[td]どしゃ[/td]
[td]*thud*[/td]
[td]See also *dosa*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]doshin[/td]
[td]ドシン[/td]
[td]どしん[/td]
[td]*heavy thud*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]doshu[/td]
[td]ドシュ[/td]
[td]どしゅ[/td]
[td]*slash*[/td]
[td]And giving a pretty deep wound.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dossa gossa[/td]
[td]ドッサッゴッサッ[/td]
[td]どっさっごっさっ[/td]
[td]*toss toss*[/td]
[td]SFX for "tossing" or flipping something in a repetitive, flowing motion.  
Ex: when cooking food with a big pan, you could lift the pan and toss the food a few times to stir instead of using the spatula.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dossari[/td]
[td]ドッサリ[/td]
[td]どっさり[/td]
[td]*fwump* *stack* *pile*[/td]
[td]With emphasis on the idea of something piled on top of each other, like a tall mountain of books or papers.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dosshiri[/td]
[td]ドッシリ[/td]
[td]どっしり[/td]
[td](1) *dignified* *imposing*;
(2) *bulky* *heavy*;
(3) *tada*[/td]
[td](3) SFX for describing a moment of pride or great importance or impact (may be exaggerated for humorous effect).[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dosshu[/td]
[td]ドッシュ[/td]
[td]どっしゅ[/td]
[td]*slash*[/td]
[td]A cut through bone.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dossun[/td]
[td]ドッスン[/td]
[td]どっすん[/td]
[td]*tha-dump*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dosu[/td]
[td]ドス[/td]
[td]どす[/td]
[td](1) *stab*; 
(2) *put down roughly*;
(3) *spurting*;
(4) *punch*;
(5) *thwack*[/td]
[td](2) To put something down roughly, something bigger as with *doka*[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dosu dosu[/td]
[td]ドスドス[/td]
[td]どすどす[/td]
[td]*stomp stomp*
*thud thud*[/td]
[td]Sound of heavy footsteps, running.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dosun[/td]
[td]ドスン[/td]
[td]どすん[/td]
[td]*thud*[/td]
[td]Sound of something heavy sitting down/falling; lighter impact than *zushin*, harder impact than *patan*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dota[/td]
[td]ドタ[/td]
[td]どた[/td]
[td]*thud*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dota bata[/td]
[td]ドタバタ[/td]
[td]どたばた[/td]
[td]*thud thud thud*[/td]
[td]Running around fussily or wildly, in panic or confusion.  Compare to *jitabata* for flailing.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dota dota[/td]
[td]ドタドタ[/td]
[td]どたどた[/td]
[td]*stomp stomp*[/td]
[td]SFX for heavy feet.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dota-n[/td]
[td]ドターン[/td]
[td]どたーん[/td]
[td]*thud*[/td]
[td]Sound of something heavy falling, heavy impact (i.e. person falling to the floor).[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dote[/td]
[td]ドテ[/td]
[td]どて[/td]
[td]*fall* *tumble*[/td]
[td]A clumsy fall.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dottaa[/td]
[td]ドッタア[/td]
[td]どったあ[/td]
[td]*thud* *fall*[/td]
[td]SFX for falling and crashing, mostly like a dull thud.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dottan[/td]
[td]ドッタン[/td]
[td]どったん[/td]
[td]*clamor* *ruckus*[/td]
[td]See also *batan*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dotto[/td]
[td]ドット[/td]
[td]どっと[/td]
[td]*suddenly*
*all at once*
*one after another*[/td]
[td]Ex: "I walked around all day, and suddenly now I'm tired."
Ex: "People exited the train one after another."[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dou[/td]
[td]ドウッ[/td]
[td]どうっ[/td]
[td]*whoosh* *fwoosh* *whoom*[/td]
[td]SFX for speedy, smooth, powerful movement.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]dou dou[/td]
[td]ドウドウ[/td]
[td]どうどう[/td]
[td]*whoa whoa*[/td]
[td]SFX for command used to stop a horse, etc.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]doyo-n[/td]
[td]ドヨーン[/td]
[td]どよーん[/td]
[td]*depressed* 
*gloomy* 
*doomed*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]doyon[/td]
[td]ドヨン[/td]
[td]どよん[/td]
[td]*sluggish* *exhausted* *depressed*[/td]
[td]See also *bo*.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#see-also. See also

[td]SFX for beckoning someone. Derived from the verb *to come* or 「来る」.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]koke[/td]
[td]コケッ[/td]
[td]こけっ[/td]
[td]*stumble* *tumble*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]kokekokko[/td]
[td]コケコッコー[/td]
[td]こけこっこー[/td]
[td]*cock a doodle doo*[/td]
[td]Sound of a rooster in the morning.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]kokekokko-[/td]
[td]コケコッコー[/td]
[td]こけこっこー[/td]
[td]*cock-a-doodle-doo*[/td]
[td]SFX for the cry of a rooster.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]koki koki[/td]
[td]コキコキ[/td]
[td]こきこき[/td]
[td]*crack crack*
*crack snap*
*snap*[/td]
[td]SFX for cracking one's joints or bones, like after a tough workout or in preparation for a fight.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]kokke kokko-[/td]
[td]コッケコッコー[/td]
[td]こっけこっこー[/td]
[td]cock-a-doodle-doo[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]kokko[/td]
[td]コッコ[/td]
[td]こっこ[/td]
[td]*clack* 
*cluck*[/td]
[td]Sound of a hen clucking.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]kokko-[/td]
[td]コッコー[/td]
[td]こっこー[/td]
[td]*cock-aa* *cock-aaa*[/td]
[td]SFX for the sound of a rooster or hen call.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]kokkun[/td]
[td]コックン[/td]
[td]こっくん[/td]
[td](1) *swallow* *gulp*;
(2) *nod*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]kokkuri kokkuri[/td]
[td]コックリコックリ[/td]
[td]こっくりこっくり[/td]
[td]*nodding off to sleep*
*zzz*[/td]
[td]SFX for the sound of sleeping or deep breathing during slumber.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]koku[/td]
[td]コク[/td]
[td]こく[/td]
[td](1) *nod* *yep*;
(2) *swallow*[/td]
[td](1) To tip one's head in agreement or approval of something;
(2) See also *kokun*, *goku* and *gokun*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]koku koku[/td]
[td]コクコク[/td]
[td]こくこく[/td]
[td](1) *yup yup*
*yep yep*
*that's right*;
(2) *nodding* 
*nod nod* 
*nods*[/td]
[td]To tip one's head repeatedly in agreement or approval of something.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]kokun[/td]
[td]コクン[/td]
[td]こくん[/td]
[td](1) *nod*;
(2) *swallow*[/td]
[td](2) See also *goku* and *gokun*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]kokuri[/td]
[td]コクリ[/td]
[td]こくり[/td]
[td]*nod*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]kokuri kokuri[/td]
[td]コクリコクリ[/td]
[td]こくりこくり[/td]
[td]*nodding off to sleep*
*nod nod*
*nods*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]kon[/td]
[td]コン[/td]
[td]こん[/td]
[td](1) *knock*;
(2) *soft cough*;
(3) *bang* *release* 
*opens*[/td]
[td](1) Often used when something is being put down softly/gently; knocking on door; 
(2) See also *goho*, *kehen*, and *koho*;
(3) SFX for something being revealed or opened.  Can be in an explosive context, such as opening a "Pandora's Box" tone.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]konkon[/td]
[td]コンコン[/td]
[td]こんこん[/td]
[td]*knock knock*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]konmori[/td]
[td]コンモリ[/td]
[td]こんもり[/td]
[td](1) *mountain full*; 
(2) *lock up*[/td]
[td](1) When something is piled up high, like fried rice; 
(2) When you lock yourself up or seclude yourself somehow (whether it'd be in your room or under the blankets).[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]koo[/td]
[td]コオ[/td]
[td]こお[/td]
[td]*fwoosh* *rumble*[/td]
[td]SFX for a great presence (can be environmental, indoors, or personified by a humanoid figure etc).[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]kopo[/td]
[td]コポ[/td]
[td]こぽ[/td]
[td]*pouring*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]kopo kopo[/td]
[td]コポコポ[/td]
[td]こぽこぽ[/td]
[td](1) *clipk clipk clipk*; 
(2) *boiling*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for pouring liquid; 
(2) SFX for coffee boiling on a coffee maker.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]kopon[/td]
[td]コポンッ[/td]
[td]こぽんっ[/td]
[td]*pop* *burst* [/td]
[td]SFX for a short, sharp, explosive sound.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]kopopopo[/td]
[td]コポポポ[/td]
[td]こぽぽぽ[/td]
[td](1) *slosh*
*splash*;
(2) *slosh* *pour*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for dropping liquid, more splash-like rather than dripping;
(2) SFX for liquid during a pouring motion or a falling motion, such as when pouring tea or juice etc.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]kori[/td]
[td]コリ[/td]
[td]こり[/td]
[td](1) *scrape*; 
(2) *chew*; 
(3) *stiff*
(4) *crunch*[/td]
[td](1) Sound of something scraping; 
(2) Biting something a little hard; 
(3) When something is a little hard/stiff; 
(4) As in eating.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]kori kori[/td]
[td]コリコリ[/td]
[td]こりこり[/td]
[td](1) *scrape*;
(2) *chew chew*;
(3) *stiff*;
(4) *crunchy*[/td]
[td](4) Ex. biting on cartilage.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]koro[/td]
[td]コロ[/td]
[td]ころ[/td]
[td]*drop* *tumble*[/td]
[td]Dropping something, something rolling or tumbling.  See also *poro*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]koro koro[/td]
[td]コロコロ[/td]
[td]ころころ[/td]
[td](1) *roll roll*; 
(2) *tumbling*
*tumble*;
(3) *flip-flop*[/td]
[td](1) Small round object rolling.  See also *goro goro*;
(2) Cutely and innocently;
(3) Ex: describing a cute but really fat dog, "cute and fat"[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]koron[/td]
[td]コロン[/td]
[td]ころん[/td]
[td]*roll* *fall* *tumble*[/td]
[td]Usually something small like a dice.  See also *poro*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]koshi koshi[/td]
[td]コシコシ[/td]
[td]こしこし[/td]
[td]*rubbing* *wiping*[/td]
[td]See also *goshi* and *geshi*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]kosho kosho[/td]
[td]コショコショ[/td]
[td]こしょこしょ[/td]
[td]*tickle tickle*[/td]
[td]SFX for tickling, a softer tickle than *kocho kocho*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]koso[/td]
[td]コソ[/td]
[td]こそ[/td]
[td]*sneak* *whisper*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]koso koso[/td]
[td]コソコソ[/td]
[td]こそこそ[/td]
[td]*escapes*
*secretly*
*secretly escapes*
*sneaks away*
*creep creep*[/td]
[td]SFX for someone sneaking around, or trying to sneak away.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]kossori[/td]
[td]コッソリ[/td]
[td]こっそり[/td]
[td](1) *sneak*
*secretly*;
(2) *gently*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]koto[/td]
[td]コト[/td]
[td]こと[/td]
[td]*clink* *clunk* *tap*[/td]
[td]SFX for putting something down softly.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]koton[/td]
[td]コトン[/td]
[td]ことん[/td]
[td]*clink*
*thunk*
*clunk*[/td]
[td]SFX for putting something down softly.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]kotsu kotsu[/td]
[td]コツコツ[/td]
[td]こつこつ[/td]
[td](1) little by little; 
(2) *tick tick*; 
(3) *clack clack* *click click*;
(4) *rhythmic*[/td]
[td](3) Clicking of high heels;
(4) Rhythmic, having a beat.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]kotsun[/td]
[td]コツン[/td]
[td]こつん[/td]
[td](1) *clink*;
(2) *step* *ka-thunk*[/td]
[td](1) Little clink, like the sound of a glass being put down or a tear gem falling;
(2) SFX for a heavy footfall, like boots.  See also *katsun*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]kotteri[/td]
[td]コッテリ[/td]
[td]こってり[/td]
[td]*rich* *heavy*[/td]
[td]SFX describing food.  Ex: Rich, heavy stew.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]kowa-[/td]
[td]コワーッ[/td]
[td]こわーっ[/td]
[td]*scary!* *nooo!*[/td]
[td]SFX for literally crying out "scary!" or "noo!" in an exaggerated manner.
Comes from the adjective "scary" or 「こわい」.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#see-also. See also

* [[List of SFX]]

title: list_of_sfx:h
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]

* 1. "SFX":#dtext-sfx
** "ha":#dtext-ha
** "hi":#dtext-hi
** "h":#dtext-h
** "he":#dtext-he
** "ho":#dtext-ho
* 2. "See also":#dtext-see-also

[/expand]

h4#sfx. SFX

h5#ha.ha:

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Romaji[/th]
[th]Katakana[/th]
[th]Hiragana[/th]
[th]English[/th]
[th]Explanation[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td]ha[/td]
[td]ハッ[/td]
[td]はっ[/td]
[td](1) *gasp*;
(2) *oh* *eh*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]ha[/td]
[td]ハッ[/td]
[td]はっ[/td]
[td](1) *gasp*; 
(2) *war cry* *hyaaah!*; 
(3) *realize*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for sudden realization, can be catching breath in shock or panic; 
(3) Realize something.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]ha[/td]
[td]ハ？[/td]
[td]は？[/td]
[td]*what?* 
*say again?*
*come again?*
*huh?*[/td]
[td]SFX for when you ask someone to repeat themselves, either out of shock and surprise or bad hearing.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]ha-[/td]
[td]ハー[/td]
[td]はー[/td]
[td]*sigh*[/td]
[td]Usually a deep sigh.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]ha-[/td]
[td]ハーッ[/td]
[td]はーっ[/td]
[td](1) *sigh*;
(2) *exhale* *gasp* *haahh*[/td]
[td](2) SFX for a dramatic releasing of breath.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]haa[/td]
[td]ハア[/td]
[td]はあ[/td]
[td]*gasp* 
*aah* 
*deep sigh* 
*pant*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]haa[/td]
[td]ハアッ[/td]
[td]はあっ[/td]
[td]*gasp*
*pant*[/td]
[td]SFX for gasping for air or a catch of breath.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]haa haa[/td]
[td]ハァ ハァ[/td]
[td]はぁ はぁ[/td]
[td]*pant pant* 
*puff puff*
*huff puff*[/td]
[td]Slightly out of breath, like *ze~ze~* when you are desperate for oxygen.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]haa-[/td]
[td]ハアーッ[/td]
[td]はあーっ[/td]
[td]*gasp* *aah* 
*deep sigh* *pant*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hagu[/td]
[td]ハグ[/td]
[td]はぐ[/td]
[td]*eating* *munching*[/td]
[td]See also *mugu*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hahaha[/td]
[td]ハハハ[/td]
[td]ははは[/td]
[td]*ha ha ha*[/td]
[td]Masculine laughter.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hai hai[/td]
[td]ハイハイ[/td]
[td]はいはい[/td]
[td]*crawl crawl*[/td]
[td]Such as a baby crawling on the floor.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hakkiri[/td]
[td]ハッキリ[/td]
[td]はっきり[/td]
[td](1) *very clear*
*clearly*;
(2) *bluntly*
*without hesitation*
[/td]
[td](1) Being able to see/hear etc something very clearly, or clear weather;
(2) In terms of confidence or untarnished honesty.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hakkushon[/td]
[td]ハックション[/td]
[td]はっくしょん[/td]
[td]*whoacchoo*
*ah-choo*
*achoo*
*at-choo*[/td]
[td]SFX for a great big sneeze.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hakushon[/td]
[td]ハクション[/td]
[td]はくしょん[/td]
[td]*whoacchoo*
*ah-choo*
*achoo*[/td]
[td]Sneezing SFX.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hamu[/td]
[td]ハム[/td]
[td]はむ[/td]
[td]*bite* *chew* *glomp*[/td]
[td]See also *bamu*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hamu hamu[/td]
[td]ハムハム[/td]
[td]はむはむ[/td]
[td]*nibble nibble* *munch munch*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hara hara[/td]
[td]ハラハラ[/td]
[td]はらはら[/td]
[td](1) *anxious* 
*uneasy*; 
(2) *pain*
*flakey*;
(3) *pit-a-pat* 
*nervous*;
(4) *tears overflowing*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for feelings of uncertainty or of being uncomfortable with something, such has getting the shivers from worrisome thoughts;
(2) Tears of anxiety falling, or things falling gently like snow;
(3) Heart going pit-a-pat, see also *doki doki*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]harara[/td]
[td]ハララ[/td]
[td]はらら[/td]
[td]*tear* *whimper*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hata[/td]
[td]ハタ[/td]
[td]はた[/td]
[td]*soft landing*[/td]
[td]Soft, quiet landing noise.  For louder rattle, see *gata*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hau[/td]
[td]ハウ[/td]
[td]はう[/td]
[td]*erk!*
*urk!*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hau hau[/td]
[td]ハウハウ[/td]
[td]はうはう[/td]
[td]*gobble*[/td]
[td]Gobbling food.  See also *gatsu* and *paku*.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#hi.hi:

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Romaji[/th]
[th]Katakana[/th]
[th]Hiragana[/th]
[th]English[/th]
[th]Explanation[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td]hi[/td]
[td]ヒッ[/td]
[td]ひっ[/td]
[td](1) *eep* *eek* *squeal*;
(2) *yikes*[/td]
[td](1) A high-pitched squeal of shock, disgust, or horror, often used for comedic effect;
(2) SFX for getting startled or surprised by something[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hi-[/td]
[td]ヒー[/td]
[td]ひー[/td]
[td](1) *shriek*;
(2) hah[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hi-e[/td]
[td]ヒーエ[/td]
[td]ひーえ[/td]
[td]*shriek*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hie-[/td]
[td]ヒエー[/td]
[td]ひえー[/td]
[td](1) *holy shit-* *eep!*;
(2) *hehh* *heh-* *heh*;
(3) *oh wow* 
*oh my gosh* 
*ohmigosh*
*omg*[/td]
[td]Expression of awe, of being impressed.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hie-[/td]
[td]ヒエーッ[/td]
[td]ひえーっ[/td]
[td](1) *holy shit-* *eep!* *no way!*;
(2) *hehh* *heh-* *heh*;
(3) *oh wow* 
*oh my gosh* 
*ohmigosh*
*omg*[/td]
[td]Expression of awe, of being impressed.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hihi-n[/td]
[td]ヒヒーン[/td]
[td]ひひーん[/td]
[td]*scream*
 *whinny*
 *screech*
 *shriek* *cry*
*neigh*[/td]
[td]Like the sound of screaming horses, or crying horses.  See also *hi-* and *hi-e*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hii[/td]
[td]ヒイイ[/td]
[td]ひいい[/td]
[td]*eek* *aaah* *eep*[/td]
[td]Exclamation of distress.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hii hii[/td]
[td]ヒィヒィ[/td]
[td]ひぃひぃ[/td]
[td]*hee hee hee*
*ehhehehe*
*giddy laughter*[/td]
[td]A really "out there" type of laughter, almost as if the subject is on drugs or is really really old.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hii-[/td]
[td]ヒイー[/td]
[td]ひいー[/td]
[td]*erk!* *eep!* *aahhahh*[/td]
[td]SfX for when you're scared or when great and (usually) unexpected physical pain is experienced.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hii-n[/td]
[td]ヒイーン[/td]
[td]ひいーん[/td]
[td]*whinny* *shriek* *scream*[/td]
[td]Sound of screaming horses.  See also *hihi-n*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hiiku[/td]
[td]ヒイク[/td]
[td]ひいく[/td]
[td]*hiccup*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hikku[/td]
[td]ヒック[/td]
[td]ひっく[/td]
[td]*hiccup*[/td]
[td]When you are drunk.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hikku hikku[/td]
[td]ヒックヒック[/td]
[td]ひっくひっく[/td]
[td]*sob sob* 
*sniff sniff*
*hic hic*[/td]
[td]In the sense that you can't stop crying and sniffling.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hiku[/td]
[td]ヒク[/td]
[td]ひく[/td]
[td]*ooo eee eee*[/td]
[td]SFX for monkey sounds.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hiku[/td]
[td]ヒクッ[/td]
[td]ひくっ[/td]
[td](1) *hiccup* *hic*; 
(2) *muscle spasm*; 
(3) *jerk*; 
(4) *flinch* *twitch*[/td]
[td](2) A small muscle spasm.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hiku hiku[/td]
[td]ヒクヒク[/td]
[td]ひくひく[/td]
[td](1) *twitch* *jerk* *flinch*;
(2) *shaking*
(3) *sniffing*[/td]
[td](1) A small muscle spasm;
(2) As with anger or sobs, compare with *shiku*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hira[/td]
[td]ヒラ[/td]
[td]ひら[/td]
[td]*pull*[/td]
[td]SFX for when pulling on clothing.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hira hira[/td]
[td]ヒラヒラ[/td]
[td]ひらひら[/td]
[td](1) *light* *flippy*; 
(2) *lacey* *frilly*;
(3) *flap flap*
*wave*[/td]
[td](1) A SFX for things like paper, skirts, handkerchiefs; 
(2) Can have *girly* notion attached to it;
(3) Ex: SFX for waving a handkerchief[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hiri hiri[/td]
[td]ヒリヒリ[/td]
[td]ひりひり[/td]
[td]*burn* *hot*
*throb throb*[/td]
[td]A burning sensation, i.e. sunburn.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hishi[/td]
[td]ヒシ[/td]
[td]ひし[/td]
[td](1) *overwhelmed*;
(2) *firmly* *tightly* *fast*;
(3) *sharply* *keenly*;
(4) *hugs*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for an expression of extreme emotion or feeling;
(2) SFX for holding on to something closely and tightly.  Comes from the term 「ひしと」;
(3) General SFX used to express something in the extreme, usually emotion-based.  Comes from the term 「ひしと」;
(4) SFX for holding onto another subject closely or tightly.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hiso[/td]
[td]ヒソ[/td]
[td]ひそ[/td]
[td]*whisper*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hiya[/td]
[td]ヒヤ[/td]
[td]ひや[/td]
[td](1) *shiver*; 
(2) *cold*[/td]
[td](1) Down the spine; 
(2) From a cold passing breeze.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#h.h:

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Romaji[/th]
[th]Katakana[/th]
[th]Hiragana[/th]
[th]English[/th]
[th]Explanation[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td]hyo[/td]
[td]ヒョ[/td]
[td]ひょ[/td]
[td]*plop* *fwump* *slump*[/td]
[td]SFX for sudden show of exhaustion, relief, or any combination of the two.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hyoe-[/td]
[td]ヒョエー[/td]
[td]ひょえー[/td]
[td]Whoah![/td]
[td]A spoken interjection.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hyoi[/td]
[td]ヒョイ[/td]
[td]ひょい[/td]
[td](1) *lifts*
*picks up*
*catches*;
(2) *pop*[/td]
[td](1) Without effort;
(2) Popping up suddenly, quick movement such as reaching.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hyoko[/td]
[td]ヒョコ[/td]
[td]ひょこ[/td]
[td](1) *poke out*;
(2) *peek*[/td]
[td](1) Like from a hole.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hyoo[/td]
[td]ヒョオオ[/td]
[td]ひょおお[/td]
[td](1) *deep breath*;
(2) *windy* *fwoo* *fwoosh*;
(3) *howl* *hoowwwll*[/td]
[td](1) When taking a deep breath, as if in preparation to cry, scream, or whine;
(2) Sound of a strong wind or breeze;
(3) The howling of a strong gust of wind[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hyu[/td]
[td]ヒュ[/td]
[td]ひゅ[/td]
[td]*swoosh*[/td]
[td]Swift movement for something cutting the air, such as leaps or a whip moving.  See also *byu*, *gyu*, and *pyu*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hyu-[/td]
[td]ヒュー[/td]
[td]ひゅー[/td]
[td](1) *wind*;
(2) *whiz* *whiz by* *whoosh*[/td]
[td](1) Wind SFX, cold wind, lonely wind.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hyu- hyu-[/td]
[td]ヒューヒュー[/td]
[td]ひゅーひゅー[/td]
[td]*tee hee* *he he* *love love*[/td]
[td]A stereotypical asian reaction to something cute, like "aww so cute!" translated into a sound effect.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hyuhha-[/td]
[td]ヒュッハー[/td]
[td]ひゅっはー[/td]
[td]*pant pant*
*wheeze*[/td]
[td]SFX for heavy, labored breathing, as if from exertion or exhaustion.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hyun[/td]
[td]ヒュン[/td]
[td]ひゅん[/td]
[td](1) *woosh*; 
(2) *pass by*; 
(3) *woosh woosh woosh*;
(4) *quick movement*;
(5) *throw*;
(6) *doink*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for throwing something; 
(2) For something passing by at lightning speed; 
(3) SFX for something spinning, like helicopter blades (notion of quietness, unlike *babababa*);
(4) Such as leaps or a whip moving, see also *byu*, *gyu*, and *pyu*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hyun[/td]
[td]ヒュンッ[/td]
[td]ひゅんっ[/td]
[td]*whoosh!*[/td]
[td]See also *hyun* (ヒュン).[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hyun hyun[/td]
[td]ヒュンヒュン[/td]
[td]ひゅんひゅん[/td]
[td]*whoosh whoosh*
*shoom shoom*
*fwoosh whoosh*
*whom whom*[/td]
[td]A repetitive SFX for a constant whirling or shearing motion.
Ex: A helicopter blade spinning.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hyuoo[/td]
[td]ヒュオオ[/td]
[td]ひゅおお[/td]
[td](1) *hoowl* *howl*;
(2) *hoowl* *howl*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for a strong wind;
(2) SFX for the cry of an animal, such as a wolf call.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hyurun[/td]
[td]ヒュルン[/td]
[td]ひゅるん[/td]
[td](1) *vroom* *vroo-vroom* *rumble*;
(2) *whoosh* *quick movement*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for the rumbling of an engine;
(2) SFX for quick, powerful movements, especially in a fight.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hyururu[/td]
[td]ヒュルル[/td]
[td]ひゅるる[/td]
[td](1) *psshhh* *fsshhh* *whoosh*; 
(2) *rumble* *blast*[/td]
[td]SFX for a rocket or fireworks launching, just before the explosion.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hyurururu[/td]
[td]ヒュルルル。。。[/td]
[td]ひゅるるる。。。[/td]
[td](1) *glooooooomy*; 
(2) *woosh woosh woosh*[/td]
[td](1) Usually a SFX to express haunted houses, the quaint, gloomy, mysterious, scariness; 
(2) Or something being thrown at you and it is closing in fast.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#ho.ho:

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Romaji[/th]
[th]Katakana[/th]
[th]Hiragana[/th]
[th]English[/th]
[th]Explanation[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td]ho[/td]
[td]ホッ[/td]
[td]ほっ[/td]
[td]*phew*[/td]
[td]A sigh of relief.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]ho ho ho[/td]
[td]ホホホ[/td]
[td]ほほほ[/td]
[td]*laugh*
*tee hee hee*
*tee he he*[/td]
[td]Laughter, specifically refined feminine laughter.  See also *ahahaha* and *ha ha ha* for masculine laughter.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]ho-[/td]
[td]ホー[/td]
[td]ほー[/td]
[td](1) *wind*;
(2) *whoop*[/td]
[td](2) SFX for owl at night.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]ho-[/td]
[td]ホー[/td]
[td]ほー[/td]
[td](1) *I see I see*
*nods nods*; 
(2) *Really?* 
*Is that so?*
*heehh*[/td]
[td](2) SFX for an answering grunt or sound that indicates you are listening to the speaker, can be sarcastic.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hogya- hogya-[/td]
[td]ホギャァホギャァ[/td]
[td]ほぎゃぁほぎゃぁ[/td]
[td]*waa waa*[/td]
[td]Crying baby SFX.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hoisatto[/td]
[td]ホイサット[/td]
[td]ほいさっと[/td]
[td]*up we get* *off we go*[/td]
[td]A little saying like よいしょ、よっこらせ  which is said when doing physical tasks that are finished easily.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hoji hoji[/td]
[td]ホジホジ[/td]
[td]ほじほじ[/td]
[td]*fiddle fiddle*[/td]
[td]When you dig into something, mostly used when people dig their nose.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hoka hoka[/td]
[td]ホカホカ[/td]
[td]ほかほか[/td]
[td]*nice and warm*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hoke[/td]
[td]ホケ[/td]
[td]ほけ[/td]
[td]*okay* *ok*[/td]
[td]More of a Japanese-ified version of the english "OK", spoken with a somewhat dejected, defeated, or agreeing sigh.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hoko hoko[/td]
[td]ホコホコ[/td]
[td]ほこほこ[/td]
[td]*mrrhmff*
*mff mff*
*munch crunch*
*munch munch*[/td]
[td]Speaking with mouth full, trying to talk around a mouthful of food.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hono bono[/td]
[td]ホノボノ[/td]
[td]ほのぼの[/td]
[td]*nice* *warm*
*peaceful*
*nice weather*
*lovely*[/td]
[td]SFX for a nice, warm, peaceful day or weather.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hote[/td]
[td]ホテ[/td]
[td]ほて[/td]
[td]*dazed*[/td]
[td]Like after you've been in the bath or sauna for too long; feeling all and a little too warm.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hote hote[/td]
[td]ホテホテ[/td]
[td]ほてほて[/td]
[td](1) *dazed*;
(2) *toddle toddle*[/td]
[td](1) As in *hote*;
(2) See also *tote*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]hotto[/td]
[td]ホット[/td]
[td]ほっと[/td]
[td]*relief*
*relieved*
*thank goodness*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]howan[/td]
[td]ホワン[/td]
[td]ほわん[/td]
[td]*soft*
*soft and warm*[/td]
[td]SFX for a warm and soft object. It could be thought of as mixing ほかほか (hokahoka, warm) and ふわふわ (fuwafuwa, soft).[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

title: list_of_sfx:s
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]

* 1. "SFX":#dtext-sfx
** "sa":#dtext-sa
** "sha":#dtext-sha
** "shi":#dtext-shi
** "sho":#dtext-sho
** "shu":#dtext-shu
** "su":#dtext-su
** "se":#dtext-se
** "so":#dtext-so
* 2. "See also":#dtext-see-also

[/expand]

h4#sfx. SFX

h5#sa.sa:

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Romaji[/th]
[th]Katakana[/th]
[th]Hiragana[/th]
[th]English[/th]
[th]Explanation[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td]sa[/td]
[td]サッ[/td]
[td]さっ[/td]
[td](1) *hiss* *rain* *water running*;
(2) *quick*;
(3) *rustle* *wind*;
(4) *step*;
(5) *stands up quickly*;
(6) *kick* *hit*;
(7) *hides quickly* *hides* *hide* *cover*[/td]
[td](1) Softer sound than *zaa*, which can also be rain; 
(2) Quick motion;
(3) Rustling, windy;
(6) Done in a fast motion.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sa sa[/td]
[td]ササ[/td]
[td]ささ[/td]
[td]*quick*[/td]
[td]Quick motion.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sa sa[/td]
[td]サッサッ[/td]
[td]さっさっ[/td]
[td]*brush* *stroke* *swish* *sketch* *fwsh*[/td]
[td]Light, quick, brushing motion.  Like writing with pencil on paper.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sa-[/td]
[td]サー[/td]
[td]さー[/td]
[td](1) *rain* *hss*;
(2) *rustling* *wind*[/td]
[td](1) Hissing, rain, water running (softer sound than *zaa*, which can also be rain).[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sa-[/td]
[td]サー[/td]
[td]さー[/td]
[td](1) *going pale*; 
(2) *fsshhh*[/td]
[td](1) Sound of someone's blood drawing, one going pale; 
(2) A light flow of water.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sa-[/td]
[td]サーッ[/td]
[td]さーっ[/td]
[td]*chill* *gloom*[/td]
[td]SFX for a worried, stressful atmosphere (can be incorporated as humor).[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]saa[/td]
[td]サァァ[/td]
[td]さぁぁ[/td]
[td]*fwsssshh*
*rainfall*
*shaaa*[/td]
[td]Light rain, or rain suddenly starting to fall.
[br]
See also *zaa* and *sa-*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]saku[/td]
[td]サク[/td]
[td]さく[/td]
[td](1) *step*;
(2) *munch* *bite*;
(3) *pierce*;
(4) *pierce* *cut*[/td]
[td](3) SFX for puncturing through a crusty object;
(4) SFX for emotional or dramatic effect, such as when a cutting remark is made[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]saku saku[/td]
[td]サクサク[/td]
[td]さくさく[/td]
[td](1) *thud thud*; 
(2) *crunch crunch*;
(3) *cut*[/td]
[td](1) SFX of soft footsteps on grass; 
(2) SFX for quietly eating something lightly crunchy, like biscuits;
(3) Cutting a thin and light object.  See also *zaku zaku*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sappari[/td]
[td]サッパリ[/td]
[td]さっぱり[/td]
[td]*refreshed*
*refreshing*
*neat*
*clean*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sara[/td]
[td]サラッ[/td]
[td]さらっ[/td]
[td]*swish* *fwish*[/td]
[td]SFX for swishing hair.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sara[/td]
[td]サラ[/td]
[td]さら[/td]
[td](1) *ruffle* *rustle*;
(2) *touch*[/td]
[td](1) To brush against something soft, usually cloth-like or somewhat elastic material;
(2) Almost a caress, done gently[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sara sara[/td]
[td]サラサラ[/td]
[td]さらさら[/td]
[td](1) *silky* *smooth*;
(2) *light*;
(3) *dry*;
(4) *squeaky clean*;
(5) *murmur*;
(6) *rustle*;
(7) *flow* *flows smoothly*[/td]
[td](1) SFX which expresses silkiness. smoothly flowing, ex. hair.  See also *zara zara*;
(5) Ex: murmuring brook or river or flowing water; See also *gasa gasa*;
(6) Ex: rustle of hair, falling powder-like material; See also *gasa gasa*;
(7) Like water or a liquid.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sasa[/td]
[td]ササッ[/td]
[td]ささっ[/td]
[td](1) *rustle*;
(2) *slash* *slice*;
(3) *scoot* *back up* *retreat*[/td]
[td](2) Like the vicious, fast movement of a sword cutting through something;
(3) To move back or retreat in the face of danger or intimidation[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sasan[/td]
[td]ササン[/td]
[td]ささん[/td]
[td]*slash slash* *slice slice* *shyaa*[/td]
[td]Like the vicious, fast movement of a sword cutting through something.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sasasa[/td]
[td]サササ[/td]
[td]さささ[/td]
[td]*slide* *show* *pass* *sneak* *dash*
*scuttle away*[/td]
[td]Quick, hasty movement, sometimes to express secretive nature of action.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sassa[/td]
[td]サッサ[/td]
[td]さっさ[/td]
[td]*style* *brush*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sassato[/td]
[td]サッサト[/td]
[td]さっさと[/td]
[td]*quickly*[/td]
[td]Usually used in a condescending or patronizing tone:
Ex: "Hurry up and finish your homework!"
Ex: "Go on now!"[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sasu sasu[/td]
[td]サスサス[/td]
[td]さすさす[/td]
[td](1) *shake shake*;
(2) *rub rub*[/td]
[td](1) Like when waking someone up.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]satto[/td]
[td]サット[/td]
[td]さっと[/td]
[td](1) *quickly*;
(2) *roughly*
*skim*[/td]
[td](1) In terms of speed;
(2) To quickly go through something, Ex: skim through the newspaper without going through all the details.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sawa[/td]
[td]サワ[/td]
[td]さわ[/td]
[td]*fresh* *refreshing* *clear* *fluent* *eloquent* *invigorating*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sawa sawa[/td]
[td]サワサワ[/td]
[td]さわさわ[/td]
[td]*feel feel*[/td]
[td]SFX for when people touch others; usually H-related.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#sha.sha:

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Romaji[/th]
[th]Katakana[/th]
[th]Hiragana[/th]
[th]English[/th]
[th]Explanation[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td]sha[/td]
[td]シャッ[/td]
[td]しゃっ[/td]
[td]*slice* *slash* *shaa* *whoosh*[/td]
[td]SFX for something slicing the air.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sha-[/td]
[td]シャー[/td]
[td]しゃー[/td]
[td](1) *pouring water*;
(2) *whoosh* *shaa*;
(3) *splash*;
(4) *slice* *slash* *whoosh*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for pouring water, like shower; Lighter than ジャー (Jya-);
(2) Something slicing the air;
(4) Something slicing the air[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]shaa shaa[/td]
[td]シャアシャア[/td]
[td]しゃあしゃあ[/td]
[td]*shamelessly* *carefree*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]shaan[/td]
[td]シャァン[/td]
[td]しゃぁん[/td]
[td]*shatter* *crash* *ka-sha* *crack*[/td]
[td]SFX for something fragile shattering into a million pieces.
Ex: A mirror or glass vase crashing and shattering.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]shaka[/td]
[td]シャカ[/td]
[td]しゃか[/td]
[td]*cocks* *clack*[/td]
[td]Sound of cocking a gun, a clacking noise.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]shaka shaka[/td]
[td]シャカシャカ[/td]
[td]しゃかしゃか[/td]
[td](1) *shake shake*;
(2) *scrape*;
(3) *whisk whisk* *whip whip*[/td]
[td](1) Usually when you're shaking something in your hand.  Usually used when making cocktails;
(3) Like when whisking eggs into cream.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]shaki[/td]
[td]シャキ[/td]
[td]しゃき[/td]
[td]*sharp* *glitter*[/td]
[td]Something sharp and glittering, like a knife or a pair of scissors.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]shakii-n[/td]
[td]シャキィーン[/td]
[td]しゃきぃーん[/td]
[td]*sharp* *glitter*[/td]
[td]SFX for something sharp.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]shakki-n[/td]
[td]シャッキーン[/td]
[td]しゃっきーん[/td]
[td]*sharp* *glitter*[/td]
[td]Something sharp and glittering, like a knife or a pair of scissors.
See also *Shaki* (less powerful).[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]shaku shaku[/td]
[td]シャクシャク[/td]
[td]しゃくしゃく[/td]
[td]*snip snip*
*cut cut*[/td]
[td]SFX for the sound of cutting, such as cutting hair with a pair of scissors.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]shan shan[/td]
[td]シャンシャン[/td]
[td]しゃんしゃん[/td]
[td]*tinkle* *ringing* *shing*[/td]
[td]SFX for lots of tiny bells ringing.[/td]
[/tr]
