[td]すっぱすっぱ[/td]
[td]*puff puff*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]suppari[/td]
[td]スッパリ[/td]
[td]すっぱり[/td]
[td]*clear* 
*clear cut*[/td]
[td]Clearly, to do something cut and clean.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]suppon[/td]
[td]スッポン[/td]
[td]すっぽん[/td]
[td]*nice fit*[/td]
[td]Sound of something fitting something perfectly, literally it is a "soft shelled turtle."[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]supponpon[/td]
[td]スッポンポン[/td]
[td]すっぽんぽん[/td]
[td]*totally naked*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sura[/td]
[td]スラッ[/td]
[td]すらっ[/td]
[td]*slim*
*skinny*
*slim figure*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sura[/td]
[td]スラ[/td]
[td]すら[/td]
[td]*quickly*[/td]
[td]SFX for fast action, whether it be movement, speed-reading, etc.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sura sura[/td]
[td]スラスラ[/td]
[td]すらすら[/td]
[td](1) *scribble scribble*;
(2) *fast*
*smooth*;
(3) *fluently*
*smoothly*;
(4) *easily*
*smoothly*[/td]
[td](1) To write something easily;
(2) Fast writing, clean writing;
(3) To speak a language fluently, usually a foreign language;
(4) To answer with great ease.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]surari[/td]
[td]スラリ[/td]
[td]すらり[/td]
[td]*slender*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]suri[/td]
[td]スリ[/td]
[td]すり[/td]
[td](1) *slide* *slip*;
(2) *yank* *pull*[/td]
[td]SFX for cloth-like material moving or being moved.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]suri suri[/td]
[td]スリスリ[/td]
[td]すりすり[/td]
[td]*rub rub*[/td]
[td]Up against something/someone.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]suru[/td]
[td]スルッ[/td]
[td]するっ[/td]
[td](1) *slip*; 
(2) *slip away*;
(3) *climb*[/td]
[td](1) In the sense you "slip something on/off," ex. silk robe; 
(2) Slip away from someone.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]suru[/td]
[td]スル[/td]
[td]する[/td]
[td]*slip* *tug*[/td]
[td]SFX for pulling something off, or for something falling or sliding off.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]suru suru[/td]
[td]スルスル[/td]
[td]するする[/td]
[td](1) *nimbly*;
(2) *slides smoothly*
*smooth*[/td]
[td](1) Small animals, etc.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sususu[/td]
[td]ススス[/td]
[td]すすす[/td]
[td]*sliding*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]suta[/td]
[td]スタ[/td]
[td]すた[/td]
[td](1) *stand up*;
(2) *land*[/td]
[td](1) Stand up swiftly;
(2) As in landing after you've jumped.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]suta suta[/td]
[td]スタスタ[/td]
[td]すたすた[/td]
[td](1) *walk straight pass* 
*power walking* 
*thud thud thud*
*tap tap tap*;
(2) *waltz by* *waltz in*[/td]
[td](1) To walk straight past someone quickly, tends to have notion that you are ignoring the things you pass; SFX for a crowd walking;
(2) SFX for a dance, formal.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sutatata[/td]
[td]スタタタ[/td]
[td]すたたた[/td]
[td](1) *running* *runs* 
*thud thud thud* 
*tmp tmp tmp*;
(2) *tmp tmp tmp* *march march*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for running;
(2) SFX for a series of even but fast steps[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sute sute[/td]
[td]ステステ[/td]
[td]すてすて[/td]
[td]*tot tot*[/td]
[td]Little kid running.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]suten[/td]
[td]ステン[/td]
[td]すてん[/td]
[td]*falling*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sutetete[/td]
[td]ステテテ[/td]
[td]すててて[/td]
[td]*runs fast*[/td]
[td]A little kid running fast.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]suto[/td]
[td]スト[/td]
[td]すと[/td]
[td]*tap* *land*[/td]
[td]SFX for the light contact of a shoe on a surface.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]suton[/td]
[td]ストン[/td]
[td]すとん[/td]
[td](1) *sit*; 
(2) *heavy thud*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sutte-n[/td]
[td]スッテーン[/td]
[td]すってーん[/td]
[td]*trip over* *fall* *tumble*[/td]
[td]Pretty dramatically.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sutto[/td]
[td]スット[/td]
[td]すっと[/td]
[td](1) *immediately*
*quickly*
*right away*
*without hesitation*;
(2) *straight down*
*straight*
*without hesitation*
[/td]
[td](1) To do something without a second thought, or to do something out of excitement or over-enthusiasm.
Ex: "He quickly stood up and invited the old lady to take his seat";
(2) Ex: "She drank the sake straight down"[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]suu[/td]
[td]スウ[/td]
[td]すう[/td]
[td](1) *slip* *pass*;
(2) *stands up*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for brushing someone off, physically walking by, or ignoring someone.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]suu-u[/td]
[td]スゥウーッ[/td]
[td]すぅうーっ[/td]
[td]*slow motion*
*dramatic*
*slowly*
*fwaaahhh*[/td]
[td]SFX for a dramatic, slow-motion effect, usually used to emphasize something.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]suya[/td]
[td]スヤ[/td]
[td]すや[/td]
[td]*sleeping*[/td]
[td]See also *gu*, *ku*, and *supigu*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]suya suya[/td]
[td]スヤスヤ[/td]
[td]すやすや[/td]
[td]*zzz* *fast asleep*
*sleeping peacefully*
*snore*[/td]
[td]SFX for sleeping or the sound of deep breathing while in sleep.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]suza[/td]
[td]スザッ[/td]
[td]すざっ[/td]
[td]*eek* *eep* *gah* *gasp*[/td]
[td]SFX for a squeal or quick breath from shock or surprise.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#se.se:

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Romaji[/th]
[th]Katakana[/th]
[th]Hiragana[/th]
[th]English[/th]
[th]Explanation[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td]sesse[/td]
[td]セッセ[/td]
[td]せっせ[/td]
[td]*quick quick*[/td]
[td]To do something quickly and efficiently.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sesseto[/td]
[td]セッセト[/td]
[td]せっせと[/td]
[td]*working steadily*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#so.so:

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Romaji[/th]
[th]Katakana[/th]
[th]Hiragana[/th]
[th]English[/th]
[th]Explanation[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td]so[/td]
[td]ソッ[/td]
[td]そっ[/td]
[td](1) *holds out* *hold* *here*;
(2) *reach*[/td]
[td](1) To present something to someone else;
(2) SFX for extending one's hand to touch something or someone.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]so-[/td]
[td]ソー[/td]
[td]そー[/td]
[td](1) *sneaky* *tip toe*;
(2) *slide* *whoosh*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sokkuri[/td]
[td]ソックリ[/td]
[td]そっくり[/td]
[td]*the same*
*alike*
*similar*
*exactly alike*[/td]
[td]Ex: "That sounds just like my mom"
Ex: "Exactly like a thief"
Ex: "This bag looks exactly like my old one"[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]soro soro[/td]
[td]ソロソロ[/td]
[td]そろそろ[/td]
[td](1) *soon*
*it's time*
*time to go*;
(2) *slowly*[/td]
[td](1) Usually used when announcing that it's time to do something, or "it's about time to ___".
Often used in everyday speech: 「そろそろ時間だ」.
(2) To perform an action with care and/or patience.
Ex: To walk slowly because one foot is in a cast.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sorori sorori[/td]
[td]ソロリソロリ[/td]
[td]そろりそろり[/td]
[td]*tip toe tip toe*
*sneak sneak*[/td]
[td]SFX for sneaking away or sneaking by very carefully.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sorya[/td]
[td]ソリャ[/td]
[td]そりゃ[/td]
[td](1) *grunt*;
(2) *yell*[/td]
[td](1) Same with オリャ (Oriya), a grunt type SFX before performing physical tasks;
(2) What to yell as you attack, a fighting taunt or war cry; see also *dorya*, *ora*, *orya*, and *uraa*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sosokusa[/td]
[td]ソソクサ[/td]
[td]そそくさ[/td]
[td]*sneak away*[/td]
[td]To leave the scene quickly, usually to avoid conflict or further troubles, or because of the intensity of the atmosphere.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sotto[/td]
[td]ソット[/td]
[td]そっと[/td]
[td](1) *gently*
*lightly*;
(2) *slip*
*quietly*[/td]
[td](1) To handle something with care.
Ex: "He held the wine glass gently in his fingertips";
(2) To make a swift, and unnoticed exit.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]souka[/td]
[td]ソウカ[/td]
[td]そうか[/td]
[td]*aha*[/td]
[td]Realization of something.  Derived from the phrase "I see" or 「そうですか」.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sowa[/td]
[td]ソワ[/td]
[td]そわ[/td]
[td]*fidget*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]sowa sowa[/td]
[td]ソワソワ[/td]
[td]そわそわ[/td]
[td](1) *restless*;
(2) *nervous*;
(3) *twinge twinge*[/td]
[td](3) SFX for that feeling felt when you have to use the bathroom.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]soyo soyo[/td]
[td]ソヨソヨ[/td]
[td]そよそよ[/td]
[td]*breeze breeze*
*fwoosh fwoosh*
*fwosh*[/td]
[td]SFX for a very gentle, light breeze.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h4#see-also. See also

* [[List of SFX]]

title: list_of_sfx:c
body:
[expand=Table of Contents]

* 1. "SFX":#dtext-sfx
** "cha":#dtext-cha
** "chi":#dtext-chi
** "cho":#dtext-cho
** "chu":#dtext-chu
* 2. "See also":#dtext-see-also

[/expand]

h4#sfx. SFX

h5#cha.cha:

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Romaji[/th]
[th]Katakana[/th]
[th]Hiragana[/th]
[th]English[/th]
[th]Explanation[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td]cha[/td]
[td]チャッ[/td]
[td]ちゃっ[/td]
[td]*ka-sha*
*ker-chak*
*shing*
*sha*[/td]
[td]SFX for a metallic sound, like when sheathing or unsheathing knives or blades.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chanto[/td]
[td]チャント[/td]
[td]ちゃんと[/td]
[td]*properly*
*perfectly*
*well done*[/td]
[td]Usually used in a patronizing tone, Ex: "Did you do your homework properly?"
[br]
Often used in everyday speech.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chapon[/td]
[td]チャポン[/td]
[td]ちゃぽん[/td]
[td]*plunk* *splash*[/td]
[td]Water sound.  See also *shapu*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chapon chapon[/td]
[td]チャポンチャポン[/td]
[td]ちゃぽんちゃぽん[/td]
[td]*splosh splosh*
*shplosh shplosh*
*splash splash*[/td]
[td]SFX for being in water.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chapu[/td]
[td]チャプ[/td]
[td]ちゃぷ[/td]
[td]*dip* *plunk*[/td]
[td]Into water.  See also *shapu*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chara[/td]
[td]チャラ[/td]
[td]ちゃら[/td]
[td](1) *clatter*;
(2) *jingle*[/td]
[td](2) SFX for a light tinkling, bell-like sound.  Can be mechanical, like a "ding" sound from a video game.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chara chara[/td]
[td]チャラチャラ[/td]
[td]ちゃらちゃら[/td]
[td](1) *rattle* *clatter*;
(2) *jingle*;
(3) *attractive* *nice*;
(4) *flirt*;
(5) *fawn* *flatter*[/td]
[td](1) See also *bara bara* and *gara gara*;
(2) SFX for a light tinkling, bell-like sound.  Can be mechanical, like a "ding" sound from a video game;
(3) SFX for dressing in a manner that attracts attention;
(4) SFX for being flirtatious in terms of dress and manner;[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]charan poran[/td]
[td]チャランポラン[/td]
[td]ちゃらんぽらん[/td]
[td](1) *irresponsible*
*doesn't care*
*apathetic*
*oh well*;
(2) *off-hand*
*carelessly*[/td]
[td](1) SFX that characterizes a personality;
(2) SFX for speech or hand motions[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chari-n[/td]
[td]チャリーン[/td]
[td]ちゃりーん[/td]
[td]*jingle* *ching*[/td]
[td]SFX for sound of coin(s) falling.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#chi.chi:

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Romaji[/th]
[th]Katakana[/th]
[th]Hiragana[/th]
[th]English[/th]
[th]Explanation[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td]chi[/td]
[td]チッ[/td]
[td]ちっ[/td]
[td](1) *damn*;
(2) *tweet*[/td]
[td](1) Damn it; a tongue click;
(2) Sound of birds, like perched in a row on a phone line.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chi[/td]
[td]チッ[/td]
[td]ちっ[/td]
[td](1) *startled*;
(2) *turns away* *looks away*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for getting caught by surprise;
(2) SFX for getting caught staring and looking away hurriedly[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chi chi[/td]
[td]チチ[/td]
[td]ちち[/td]
[td](1) *high shrill noise*;
(2) *chirping*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chi chi chi[/td]
[td]チッチッチ[/td]
[td]ちっちっち[/td]
[td](1) *tick tick tick*; 
(2) *non-non-non*;
(3) *come come*
*come here*;
(4) *chirp chirp*[/td]
[td](1) Ticking of a clock; 
(2) Like humming a tune;
(3) How you call a cat;
(4) SFX for the chirping of a bird.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chi--n[/td]
[td]チーーン[/td]
[td]ちーーん[/td]
[td](1) *ching ching*; 
(2) *ping!* *ching!*[/td]
[td](1) Sound of a small bell ringing, usually a Buddhist chime before prayers; 
(2) SFX for microwave stopping.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chi-n[/td]
[td]チーン[/td]
[td]ちーん[/td]
[td]*ding* *bing*[/td]
[td]Sound of a bell.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chika chika[/td]
[td]チカチカ[/td]
[td]ちかちか[/td]
[td](1) *flick flick* 
*lights flickering*;
(2) *eyes tired*;
(3) *sparkle sparkle*[/td]
[td](1) Can be light from the stars, see also *pika pika*;
(2) Eyes getting tired from staring at computer or TV;
(3) Like a "wow" effect from a revealing moment, or exposure to a glittery wonderland.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chikku takku[/td]
[td]チックタック[/td]
[td]ちっくたっく[/td]
[td]*tick tack* 
*tick tock* 
*hickory dickory dock*[/td]
[td]Sound of clock, almost in a rhythmic sing-song way.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chiku[/td]
[td]チクッ[/td]
[td]ちくっ[/td]
[td]*prick* *sting*[/td]
[td]SFX for a light prickly painful sensation, like when getting pricked with a needle or burr.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chiku chiku[/td]
[td]チクチク[/td]
[td]ちくちく[/td]
[td]*itch itch* *prickle*[/td]
[td]A pricking pain.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chima chima[/td]
[td]チマチマ[/td]
[td]ちまちま[/td]
[td]*slowly* *fiddly* *little by little*[/td]
[td]SFX to explain someone doing a task too slowly or a little by little when it can be done a lot faster and more efficiently.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chin[/td]
[td]チン[/td]
[td]ちん[/td]
[td]*ting* *ding*[/td]
[td]Like the sound of a bell or chime; can be analogous or mechanical.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chin[/td]
[td]チンッ[/td]
[td]ちんっ[/td]
[td]*clang* *cling* 
*ding* *chink*[/td]
[td]SFX for a light metallic sound, can be mechanical.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chin chin[/td]
[td]チンチン[/td]
[td]ちんちん[/td]
[td]*clangity clang*[/td]
[td]Like the sound of a tram passing by.  See also *gatan goton*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chinpankanpun[/td]
[td]チンパンカンプン[/td]
[td]ちんぱんかんぱん[/td]
[td]*clueless*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chira[/td]
[td]チラッ[/td]
[td]ちらっ[/td]
[td]*glance*
*peek*[/td]
[td]A quick and momentary, quick glance.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chira[/td]
[td]チラ[/td]
[td]ちら[/td]
[td]*glance*[/td]
[td]A quick look, or momentarily catching something in sight.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chira chira[/td]
[td]チラチラ[/td]
[td]ちらちら[/td]
[td]*glance glance*[/td]
[td]Usually quickly and momentary.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chira hora[/td]
[td]チラホラ[/td]
[td]ちらほら[/td]
[td]*flutter flutter*[/td]
[td]SFX for something falling lightly, like snowflakes falling gently through the atmosphere.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chirari[/td]
[td]チラリ[/td]
[td]ちらり[/td]
[td]*quick sideways glance*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chiri[/td]
[td]チリ[/td]
[td]ちり[/td]
[td]*smirk* *heh*[/td]
[td]SFX for a sardonic, sarcastic grunt or grin.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chiri chiri[/td]
[td]チリチリ[/td]
[td]ちりちり[/td]
[td](1) *crisp* *burnt* *black*;
(2) *heat* *cold shiver*;
(3) *crackle crackle* *crackle pop*[/td]
[td](1) Something almost burning or slightly burnt;
(2) Tingle of heat, shiver of cold; see also *zoku* for shiver;
(3) When something is burning, similar to the sounds made by an active fireplace.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chirin[/td]
[td]チリン[/td]
[td]ちりん[/td]
[td]*ching ching*[/td]
[td]Sound of chime, like on a bicycle.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chiron[/td]
[td]チロン[/td]
[td]ちろん[/td]
[td]*quick sideways glance*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chirori[/td]
[td]チロリ[/td]
[td]ちろり[/td]
[td]*glance*[/td]
[td]See also *chira*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chiru[/td]
[td]チル[/td]
[td]ちる[/td]
[td]*lick*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]chiya hoya[/td]
[td]チヤホヤ[/td]
[td]ちやほや[/td]
[td]*being spoiled*[/td]
[td]To be spoiled by everyone.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

h5#cho.cho:

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Romaji[/th]
[th]Katakana[/th]
[th]Hiragana[/th]
[th]English[/th]
[th]Explanation[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td]choi[/td]
[td]チョイッ[/td]
[td]ちょいっ[/td]
[td]*fsh* *fwip* *shwip*[/td]
[td]A white-noise type SFX for something appearing, existing, or a movement.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]choki choki[/td]
[td]チョキチョキ[/td]
[td]ちょきちょき[/td]
[td]*cut cut* 
*chop chop*
*snipping*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]

[td](1) As in eating or chewing something crunchy.

*bari* = crunchy, i.e. chips;

See also *bachi* and *biri biri*;

*bari bari* = crunchy, i.e. chips;
*kori kori* = soft crunch, i.e. broccoli or asparagus;

*pari pari* = quiet crackle.
See also *bachi* and *biri biri*;

[br]
See also *bari*.[/td]

(5) *flap*;
(6) *ta-dah* *tada* *ta-da*;

[td](1) Usually used when a stack of clothes/paper is put down or falling down, see also *pasa*; Also used when a lot of hair has been cut off.

*pat pat*[/td]
[td]SFX for slapping or smacking something or someone.
Oftentimes used when caught in a fit of helpless laughter or mirth.[/td]

*splurt*[/td]

[td]*gazing vacantly*[/td]
[td]Derived from "to be daydreaming" or 「ぼけとする」.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]boki[/td]
[td]ボキッ[/td]
[td]ぼきっ[/td]
[td](1) *snap* *whack*;
(2) *cracking*[/td]

[/tr]
[tr]
[td]boko[/td]
[td]ボコッ[/td]
[td]ぼこっ[/td]
[td](1) *thump* *bump*;
(2) *crumble*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]boko[/td]
[td]ボコ[/td]
[td]ぼこ[/td]
[td](1) *bash*;
(2) *boiling* *bubbling* *pop*[/td]
[td](2) Can also be any bursting sound, see *buku*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]boko boko[/td]
[td]ボコボコ[/td]
[td]ぼこぼこ[/td]
[td](1) *worn out* *bashed*; 
(2) *bumpy*;
(3) *ground falling apart*[/td]
[td](1) State of being bashed up.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]bomu[/td]
[td]ボム[/td]
[td]ぼむ[/td]
[td]*poof*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]bon[/td]
[td]ボン[/td]
[td]ぼん[/td]
[td]*appears*[/td]
[td]SFX for when something magically and suddenly appears.  Often seen with a puff of smoke (see also *pon*, *pom*, and *dororonpa*).[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]bon[/td]
[td]ボンッ[/td]
[td]ぼんっ[/td]
[td]*burning*
*fiercely*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]bonyari[/td]
[td]ボンヤリ[/td]
[td]ぼんやり[/td]
[td](!) *absent minded*
*idly*
*vaguely*;
(2) *dimly*[/td]
[td](1) Ex: absent-minded in class;
(2) Ex: the island is dimly visible.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]boo-[/td]
[td]ボォー[/td]
[td]ぼぉー[/td]
[td]*gazey*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]bori bari[/td]
[td]ボリバリ[/td]
[td]ぼりばり[/td]
[td]*munch crunch*
*munch munch*
*crunch crunch*[/td]
[td]SFX for eating something, chewing on something crunchy.
[br]
See also *bori* (ボリ), and *bari* (バリ).[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]bori bori[/td]
[td]ボリボリ[/td]
[td]ぼりぼり[/td]
[td](1) *scratch scratch*; 
(2) *crunch crunch*[/td]
[td](1) Like on the thigh; 
(2) When one is chewing something hard like ice.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]boro[/td]
[td]ボロ[/td]
[td]ぼろ[/td]
[td](1) *in disrepair*
*beyond disrepair*
*damaged*
*worn-out*
*tattered*
*shambles*;
(2) *crushed* 
*destroyed*;
(3) *cry* *drip*[/td]
[td](3) SFX for tears falling.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]boro boro[/td]
[td]ボロボロ[/td]
[td]ぼろぼろ[/td]
[td](1) *crumble*; 
(2) *torn*;
(3) *rumpled* 
*scuffed 
*slightly damaged*
*tattered*
*worn-out*;
(4) *cry* *drip*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for something falling apart; 
(2) For something in a torn state; 
(4) SFX for tears flowing.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]bosa bosa[/td]
[td]ボサボサ[/td]
[td]ぼさぼさ[/td]
[td](1) *messy*; 
(2) *gazey*[/td]
[td](1) Messy hair; 
(2) Sitting around doing nothing when you're meant to be doing something.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]bosho[/td]
[td]ボショ[/td]
[td]ぼしょ[/td]
[td]*sad*[/td]
[td]SFX for a somber, disappointed, or upset mood.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]boso[/td]
[td]ボソ[/td]
[td]ぼそ[/td]
[td](1) *mumble* *mutter*;
(2) *whisper*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]bossa bassa[/td]
[td]ボッサッバッサッ[/td]
[td]ぼっさっばっさっ[/td]
[td]*flip flip* *fwp fwp* *toss toss*[/td]
[td]SFX for a smooth, skillful, repetitive motion.  Ex: When a professional chef flips pancakes in the pan, or some other type of food.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]bosu[/td]
[td]ボス[/td]
[td]ぼす[/td]
[td]*crash*[/td]
[td]SFX for crashing into something.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]bosu[/td]
[td]ボスッ[/td]
[td]ぼすっ[/td]
[td]*slam* *crash* *ka-bam* *bam* *smash*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]bota bota[/td]
[td]ボタボタ[/td]
[td]ぼたぼた[/td]
[td](1) *drip*;
(2) *thud thud*[/td]
[td](1) Large amount of liquid.  See also *pota pota*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]bote[/td]
[td]ボテ[/td]
[td]ぼて[/td]
[td]*fall* *clomp*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]boto boto[/td]
[td]ボトボト[/td]
[td]ぼとぼと[/td]
[td](1) *falling*;
(2) *drip*[/td]
[td](2) Ping.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]botsu[/td]
[td]ボツ[/td]
[td]ぼつ[/td]
[td]*whoosh*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]botsu botsu[/td]
[td]ボツボツ[/td]
[td]ぼつぼつ[/td]
[td]*drip drip*[/td]
[td]Large raindrops falling as opposed to *Potsu potsu*[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]bou[/td]
[td]ボウ[/td]
[td]ぼう[/td]
[td](1) *bwoom* *alights* *whoosh*;
(2) *whoosh*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for something catching fire;
(2) SFX for something moving very quickly through the air[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]boutto[/td]
[td]ボウット[/td]
[td]ぼうっと[/td]
[td]*faintly*
*vaguely*
*dreamily*
*dazed*[/td]
[td]Usually when someone isn't paying attention.
Often used in Japanese expression: 「何をぼうっとしているんだ？」or "what're you daydreaming about?"[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]boyo-n[/td]
[td]ボヨーン[/td]
[td]ぼよーん[/td]
[td]*bounce*[/td]
[td]SFX for springy action, can also be used instead of *purin*[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]boyoyo-n[/td]
[td]ボヨヨーン[/td]
[td]ぼよよーん[/td]
[td]*bounce*[/td]
[td]SFX for double-springy action, can also be used instead of *purin*[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

* [[List of SFX]]

title: list_of_sfx:w
body:

[/expand]

h4#sfx. SFX

h5#wa.wa:

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Romaji[/th]
[th]Katakana[/th]
[th]Hiragana[/th]
[th]English[/th]
[th]Explanation[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td]wa[/td]
[td]ワ[/td]
[td]わ[/td]
[td]*wow!* *ack!* *whoa!*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]wa[/td]
[td]ワ[/td]
[td]わ[/td]
[td](1) *boo!*
(2) *ack!*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]wa[/td]
[td]ワッ[/td]
[td]わっ[/td]
[td]*wah!* *yay!* *yeeahh!* *cheer* *woot!*[/td]
[td]SFX for a cheer, or a happy atmosphere.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]wa-[/td]
[td]ワー[/td]
[td]わー[/td]
[td](1) *roar*;
(2) *wow*;
(3) *yeaahh* *cheer* *applause*;
(4) *waaah*[/td]
[td](1) (A crowd's) excited roar.  See also *wai wai* and *wara wara*;
(4) SFX for cheering or SFX for cry of dismay or despair.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]wa-[/td]
[td]ワーッ[/td]
[td]わーっ[/td]
[td]*wow* *yay* *delight*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]wa-i[/td]
[td]ワーイ[/td]
[td]わーい[/td]
[td]*yay* *woohoo* *yes* *yeah*[/td]
[td]Positive cheering, expression of cheerfulness or happiness.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]wa-n[/td]
[td]ワーンッ[/td]
[td]わーんっ[/td]
[td](1) *bawling* *waahh*;
(2) *waahh* *grrr*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for a long, wailing cry of despair;
(2) SFX for a loud cry of outrage or unhappiness with something[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]wa-n wa-n[/td]
[td]ワーンワーン[/td]
[td]わーんわーん[/td]
[td]*waah waah*
*booh hoo*
*bawling*[/td]
[td]SFX for crying loudly and hysterically.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]wa-wa-[/td]
[td]ワーワー[/td]
[td]わーわー[/td]
[td](1) *roar*;
(2) *chatter* *rustle*[/td]
[td](1) (A crowd's) excited roar.  See also *wai wai* and *wara wara*;
(2) SFX for background noise of pedestrians on the street.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]waa[/td]
[td]ワア[/td]
[td]わあ[/td]
[td](1) *wow*;
(2) *roar* *yaahh!*;
(3) *cheer* *applause*[/td]
[td](2) Like the war cries of soldiers in battle, or cry of protest.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]waffun[/td]
[td]ワッフン[/td]
[td]わっふん[/td]
[td]*grunt*[/td]
[td]Light SFX...strange grunt.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]wafu[/td]
[td]ワフ[/td]
[td]わふ[/td]
[td](1) *grunt*;
(2) *woof*[/td]
[td](1) Light SFX...strange grunt;
(2) SFX for dog "woof-ing", see also *Wafu wafu*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]wafu wafu[/td]
[td]ワフワフ[/td]
[td]わふわふ[/td]
[td](1) *grunt grunt*
*mumble mumble*;
(2) *woof woof*[/td]
[td](1) Light SFX...strange grunt;
(2) SFX for dog "woof-ing", see also *Wafu*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]wafu-n[/td]
[td]ワフーン[/td]
[td]わふーん[/td]
[td]*whine*[/td]
[td]High-pitched, sad whine of a dog.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]wahaha[/td]
[td]ワハハ[/td]
[td]わはは[/td]
[td]*hahaha*
*bwahaha*
*ahaha*[/td]
[td]Full-on, loud laughter.
[br]
See also *hahaha* (ハハハ).[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]wai[/td]
[td]ワイ[/td]
[td]わい[/td]
[td]*yay!* *delight*[/td]
[td]Feminine exclamation of delight, spoken by a character.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]wai wai[/td]
[td]ワイワイ[/td]
[td]わいわい[/td]
[td]*chatter chatter*[/td]
[td]To explain lively action/noise, like *Gaya gaya*[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]waki waki[/td]
[td]ワキワキ[/td]
[td]わきわき[/td]
[td]*restless*[/td]
[td]Itching-to-grab gesture.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]waku[/td]
[td]ワク[/td]
[td]わく[/td]
[td]*excitement* *happy*[/td]
[td]Cute anticipation.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]waku waku[/td]
[td]ワクワク[/td]
[td]わくわく[/td]
[td]*excited* 
*nervous* 
*trembling*[/td]
[td]Happy, cute anticipation.
[br]
See also *baku baku*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]wan[/td]
[td]ワン！[/td]
[td]わん！[/td]
[td]*woof!*[/td]
[td]SFX for the call of a dog or wolf.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]wan wan[/td]
[td]ワンワン[/td]
[td]わんわん[/td]
[td]*bow-wow*
*woof woof*
*wuff wuff*
*ruff ruff*[/td]
[td]SFX for the sound of a dog calling.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]wana wana[/td]
[td]ワナワナ[/td]
[td]わなわな[/td]
[td]*tremble tremble* 
*shake shake*[/td]
[td]Trembling from fear or anger; trembling all over.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]wara wara[/td]
[td]ワラワラ[/td]
[td]わらわら[/td]
[td]*chatter chatter*[/td]
[td]Crowded people, usually small kids.  See also *waa* and *wai wai*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]wasa wasa[/td]
[td]ワサワサ[/td]
[td]わさわさ[/td]
[td]*rustle rustle*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]wasshi[/td]
[td]ワッシ[/td]
[td]わっし[/td]
[td]*one-two*
*one-and-a-two*
*one-two-three*
*hee haa*
*huff huff*[/td]
[td]SFX for the sound one makes while motivating oneself to use physical effort or to exert oneself physically.
Ex: Counting out "one-two-three, and a one-two-three" while doing jumping jacks.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]wata wata[/td]
[td]ワタワタ[/td]
[td]わたわた[/td]
[td](1) *panic*;
(2) *flap flap*[/td]
[td](1) Moving busily;
(2) SFX for arms flailing around, trying to cover a mistake.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]wawa[/td]
[td]ワワ[/td]
[td]わわ[/td]
[td]*whoa*[/td]
[td]In a "what the heck" way.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]waza waza[/td]
[td]ワザワザ[/td]
[td]わざわざ[/td]
[td]*expressly* *intentionally*[/td]
[td]To go through the trouble of doing something.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[tr]
[td]ukkari[/td]

*gah* 
*damn*
*oops*;
(2) *slip*
*careless*;
(3) *off guard*[/td]
[td]Where you forget to do something because you were daydreaming.  An accident occurring because you weren't paying attention.  Inadvertently, carelessly.[/td]

[tr]

[td]うまうま[/td]

[/tr]
[tr]
[td]umu[/td]
[td]ウム[/td]

title: bras_d'honneur
body:
"Arm of Honor" in French, a rude [[gesture]] usually consisting of one arm, bent at ninety degrees and turned upward, while the opposite hand sits in the crook of the elbow or grips the bicep. What someone chooses to do with the hand of the upturned arm may differ. 

Commonly seen around the world as a full-body "fuck you", equivalent in meaning to the, and often used together with, the [[middle finger]].

In Japanese culture, however, it's perceived as a form of muscle [[flexing]], indicating confidence and determination.  See topic #9716.

h4. External links

* "Bras d'honneur on Wikipedia":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bras_d'honneur

title: lorum_piercing
body:
A [[penis piercing]], placed horizontally on the underside at its base, where the shaft meets the [[testicles]]. The word "lorum" is a portmanteau of the words "low" and "frenum", so named because it is essentially a very low-placed [[frenulum piercing|frenum piercing]].

h4. See also

title: baton
body:
Ambiguous tag, tag the specific type of baton or stick in question.

h4. Types

* [[conductor baton]], a wand used by a [[conductor]] to instruct musical groups.
* [[baton (weapon)]], a [[police]] baton.
* [[cane]], a long stick used as a walking support or fashion accessory.
* [[expandable baton]], a metal shaft baton that collapses.
* [[juggling club]], a baton with a heavy end, used in [[juggling]] and [[rhythmic gymnastics]].
* [[marching band baton]], a baton used in [[marching band]]s.
* [[pointer]], a stick used by [[teacher]]s.
* [[relay baton]], a rod used in [[relay race]]s.
* [[ribbon baton]], a baton with a [[ribbon]] at one end, used in [[rhythmic gymnastics]].
* [[ritual baton]], a flat rod held by ancient Chinese and Japanese noblemen and Shinto priests
* [[scepter]], a ceremonial rod symbolizing power.
* [[staff]], a long stick used for fighting or magic casting.
* [[tonfa]], a side-handle baton.
* [[traffic baton]], a red (or bright colored) baton used as a signaling aid in directing traffic or crowds.
* [[twirl baton]], a metal rod with two rubber stoppers at each end, used as a tool for athletic [[playing sports|sports]].
* [[wand]], a baton used by [[magical girl]]s or [[magician]]s.
* [[white cane]], a special cane for people who are blind or visually impaired.

h4. See also

* [[club (weapon)|]]
* [[scepter]]

title: wirbel_(sousou_no_frieren)
body:
Second-class mage and the leader of the eighth party along with along with [[Scharf_(sousou_no_frieren)|]] and [[Ehre (sousou no frieren)|]] during the first stage of the First Class Mage Exam. He is the captain of the Northern Magic Corps and is thus a very experienced mage.

Wirbel is a fair, middle-aged man with [[messy hair|messy]], asymmetrical [[white hair]]. He wears two [[earrings]] on each ear and a [[belt collar|belt-like choker]] around his neck.

His outfit consists of a [[long coat|long]] [[white coat]] that extends below his knees, embellished with [[fur trim|thick black fur lining]] on the collar and sleeves, and tassels adorning the chest. Beneath the coat, he sports a [[white shirt]] with black spots and two crisscrossing straps creating an X-pattern across his torso. This is paired with [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]] and long [[black pants]] wrapped in black [[bandages]] around the thighs and ankles.

title: baroque_works
body:
A criminal group led by [[Crocodile (one Piece)|]] in the world of [[One Piece]]. Disbanded.

They paired up male and female agents and relied on codenames to keep their operations secret. The lower an agents number the higher up in the organisation were they.

[b]Top Members:[/b]
[[Crocodile (one Piece)|Mr.0]] & [[Nico Robin|Miss All-Sunday]]

[b]Officer Agents:[/b]
[[Daz Bones|Mr.1]] & [[paula (one piece)|Miss Doublefinger]]
[[Bon Clay|Mr.2 Bon Clay]] (no partner)
[[Galdino|Mr.3]] & [[Miss Goldenweek]]
[[mister four (one piece)|Mr.4]] & [[Miss Merry Christmas]]
[[mister five (one piece)|Mr.5]] & [[Miss Valentine]]

[b]Frontier Agents:[/b]
Mr.6 & Miss Mother's Day
[[Mister Seven (one Piece)|Mr.7]] & [[Miss Father's Day]]
[[Igaram|Mr.8]] & [[Miss Monday]]
[[Mister Nine (one Piece)|Mr.9]] & [[Nefertari Vivi|Miss Wednesday]]
Mr.10 & Miss Tuesday
[[Mister Eleven (one Piece)|Mr.11]] & Miss Thursday

[b]The Unluckies:[/b]
[[mister thirteen (one piece)|Mr.13]] & [[miss Friday]]

The facial expression where the mouth looks like a 3 on its side. Likened to the face of a [[cat]], and commonly used to portray innocence, cuteness, or mischievousness in an anime or manga.

Not to be confused with [[o3o]], which is the expression of having [[puckered lips]].

h4. See also
* [[;3]]
* [[x3]]
* [[snake mouth]]
* [[uwu]]
* [[Tag Group:Face tags]]

title: nuwa_(megami_tensei)
body: Goddess in Chinese mythology. Read as Joka in Japanese.

title: maria_(megami_tensei)
body:
A demon in the [[megami_tensei|Megami Tensei]] series who, as the name implies, is directly based on the [[virgin_mary|Virgin Mary]] herself. Appeared for the first time in [[Shin Megami Tensei NINE]], as the artificial goddess of Idea Space.
Most famously depicted as a white statue-esque figure.

title: order_of_messiah
body:
An organization in the [[Shin Megami Tensei]] series. It represents the Law alignment, consists of devoted followers of God and establish to establish the Millennium Kingdom in most appearances. 

It is an antagonistic entity in [[Shin Megami Tensei II]], serving as a corrupt ruling force of the Tokyo Millennium. [[Zayin (megami tensei)|]], [[Beth (megami tensei)|]] and [[Hiroko (megami tensei)|]] are members of the Order's infamous Temple Knights.

title: scathach_(megami_tensei)
body:
Scathach is a recurring demon in the Shin Megami Tensei series.

    "A warrior queen of the Land of Shadows in Celtic lore. She taught the Irish hero Cu Chulainn the art of war, and gave him the spear Gae Bolg." 
    —Compendium Info 

Scathach ("Shadowy") is a figure in the Ulster Cycle of Irish mythology. She is a legendary Scottish warrior woman and martial arts teacher who trains the legendary Ulster hero Cu Chulainn in the arts of combat. Texts describe her homeland as "Alpi", which commentators associate with Alba, the Gaelic name of Scotland; she is especially associated with the Isle of Skye, where her residence Dún Scáith (Fort of Shadows) stands.

Scathach's instruction of Cu Chulainn appears in Tochmarc Emire (The Wooing of Emer), a foretale to the great epic 'Táin Bó Cúailnge'. Cu Chulainn and Emer fall in love, but her father Forgall forbade the union until Cu Chulainn has completed his warrior training. Cu Chulainn and his friend Ferdiad travel to Dún Scáith, where Scathach teaches them feats of arms, and gives Cu Chulainn his deadly spear, the Gáe Bulg.

Cu Chulainn begins an affair with Scathach's daughter Uathach, but accidentally breaks her fingers. She screams, calling her lover Cochar Croibhe to the room. Despite Uathach's protests, he challenges Cu Chulainn to a duel; Cu Chulainn dispatches him easily.

To make it up to Uathach and Scathach, Cu Chulainn assumes Cochar's duties, and becomes Uathach's lover. Scathach eventually promises her daughter to him, without requiring the traditional bride price. Scathach also grants Cu Chulainn the "friendship of her thighs" (they have sex) when his training is almost complete. When her rival, the warrior woman Aífe, threatens her territory, Cu Chulainn defeats her in battle and forces her to make peace. Aífe also sleeps with Cu Chulainn, producing his son Connla, who Cu Chulainn kills years later without realizing he is his son.

title: mag_(warframe)
body:
A Player-controllable character in [[Warframe]].

Mag is a female warframe characterized by the metal coils around her arms and glass bubble helmet, which often has swirling [[light_particles|light particles]] within it.

She is a [[humanoid_robot|humanoid robot]], though in many cases will undergo some level of [[humanization]].

She has a [[mag_prime_(warframe)|Prime]] variant.

title: ready_player_one
body:
A 2011 [[science fiction]] novel, and the debut work of American author Ernest Cline. 

The story, set in a dystopian 2045, follows teen [[otaku]] protagonist [[Wade Owen Watts]] on his adventures searching for an easter egg in a worldwide virtual reality MMO video game called "OASIS", the discovery of which could lead him to inherit the late game creator's massive megafortune and total control and ownership of the game. 

A film adaptation was released on March 29, 2018 in most countries. It premiered in Japan on April 20, 2018.

h4. Characters

title: body_switch
body:
When two characters swap bodies.

This means the characters' entire identities (including memories etc) have been transferred to the other's body (in contrast to [[personality switch]], where only the personality is switched).

There should be some clear indication that the swapping has taken place in the picture or in the commentary, otherwise it's just a [[personality switch]].

A good example is post #4619026.

title: grasslands
body:
A grassland is an area in which the vegetation is dominated by a nearly continuous cover of [[grass|grasses]]. Grasslands occur in environments conducive to the growth of this plant cover but not to that of taller plants, particularly trees and shrubs.

h4. See also

* [[Plain]]
* [[Savannah]]

title: plain
body:
A [b]plain[/b] or as flatland, is a flat expanse of land that generally does not change much in elevation. Mostly covered in [[grass]] and primarily treeless.

For similar place full of flowers or crops, see [[field]].
For the far colder counterpart, see [[tundra]].
For the warmer tropical counterpart with few trees like acacia or baobabs, see [[savannah|savanna]].

h4. See also

* [[Grasslands]]
* [[Nature]]
* [[Outdoors]]
* [[Tag Group:Locations]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Plain":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plain

title: savannah
body:
A savanna or savannah is a mixed woodland-grassland ecosystem characterized by the trees being sufficiently widely spaced so that the canopy does not close. It is characterized by coarse [[grass|grasses]] and scattered tree growth, especially on the margins of the tropics where the rainfall is seasonal, as in eastern [[Africa]].

h4. See also

* [[Grasslands]]
* [[Plain]]

title: ayase_eli
body:
Character from [[Love Live! School Idol Project]]. The no-nonsense student council president of Otonokizaka High School. She and her sister [[ayase alisa|Alisa]] are a quarter Russian. Friends with [[Tojo Nozomi]], the vice president.

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] that is tied up into a [[ponytail]], usually with a [[white scrunchie|white]] [[hair scrunchie]] or [[hair ribbon]].

Voiced by [[Nanjou Yoshino]].

title: team_dim_sun
body:
The villainous organization in [i][[pokemon_ranger_2|Pokémon Ranger 2]][/i], led by Blake Hall of Altru Incorporated. Prominent members include the Sinis Trio, consisting of [[Ice (Pokemon)|Ice]], [[Lavana (Pokemon)|Lavana]] and [[Heath (Pokemon)|Heath]]; they are still superseded by [spoiler]Kincaid, who masquerades as a teacher in the Pokémon Ranger Academy[/spoiler].

The goal of Team Dim Sun is to awaken Darkrai and submerge all of Almia in unending darkness.

Known as [b]Yamiyami-dan[/b] in Japanese.

title: vampire_girl_karina
body:
Karina is a mischievous young vampire.

Vampires no longer hunt human blood in modern society. Any vampire with grace and manners will buy blood from blood banks at fair price. However, born in a precious vampire household, Karina wanted to have little fun with her food.

She disguised herself as an innocent lost girl in forest and took little bits of blood from unsuspecting adventurers. She did it because it is "very sweet and lots of fun". If you are to accompany her, you better prepare some iron supplements.
other_names: カリナ(ガーディアンテイルズ)

title: monster_musume_no_iru_nichijou
body:

title: hisako_(angel_beats!)
body:
Hisako is a character from the anime [[Angel Beats!]].

She is the [[electric guitar|lead guitarist]] of the in-universe band Girls Dead Monster and plays a blue Fender Jazzmaster. She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]], that she typically wears in a [[ponytail]] and [[grey eyes]]. She usually wears [[Shinda Sekai Sensen uniform]].

During a 2024 collaboration event between Angel Beats! and [[Heaven Burns Red]], her full name was revealed to be Fuchida Hisako.

title: the_scream
body:
"A famous 1893 painting":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Scream] by [[Edvard Munch]].

Munch recalled that he had been out for a walk at sunset when suddenly the setting sun's light turned the clouds "a blood red". He sensed an "infinite scream passing through nature". Scholars agree it was the immense eruption of the [[volcano]] Mount Krakatoa, which could be heard 5,000km away and colored skies across the world that prompted the reaction.

The agonized face in the painting has become one of the most iconic images of art, seen as symbolizing the anxiety of the human condition. Munch's work, including The Scream, would go on to have a formative influence on the Expressionist movement. And the subject of many [[fine art parody|fine art parodies]].

body: The [b]Charles de Gaulle[/b] (hull number: R91) is a nuclear-powered CATOBAR [[aircraft carrier]] and the flagship of the [[French Navy]] (Marine Nationale). It is currently the only nuclear-powered, as well as [[aircraft catapult|catapult-equipped]] aircraft carrier in service with any other country besides the [[united states navy|United States]], and operates with the [[dassault rafale|Dassault Rafale M]] [[fighter jet|multirole fighter]].

title: year_of_the_goat
body:
The Goat is the eighth animal in the Chinese zodiac.  Years of the Goat include: 1931, 1943, 1955, 1967, 1979, [[1991]], [[2003]], [[2015]], 2027.

A [b]Year of the Goat[/b] always occurs after a [[year of the horse|Horse year]] and before a [[year of the monkey|Monkey year]].

The Chinese word (kanji) 羊 refers to both goats and [[sheep]], and is interpreted in Japan only as sheep.

h4.See also

* [[Chinese zodiac]]

title: personality_core
body:
Small, eyeball shaped robots that originate from the [[Portal (series)|]] series, personality cores are round, white or gray colored, have a large single 'eye' at its center (which may or may not have eye lids), and are usually seen communicating and speaking with those around them. 

Their personalities in question are unique to each individual core, but typically focus on a single personality trait to behave as, like Wheatley (klutzy and idiotic), the curiosity core (to be curious and question everything around it), or Rick (to be adventurous and get into trouble for the sake of fun). The cores are only seemingly used to provide support to humans (since they have no weaponry and only seem capable of minor hacking) and to restrict the intelligence of larger and more sophisticated AIs (such as [[GLaDOS]] and Wheatley (only during his takeover of the Aperture Science facility though)).

h4. List of Cores
* [[adventure_core|Adventure Core/Rick]]
* [[Anger Core]]
* [[cake_core|Cake Core/Intelligence Core]]
* [[Curiosity Core]]
* [[Fact Core]]
* [[Morality Core]]
* [[Space Core]]
* [[Wheatley]]

title: dune:_part_two
body:
[b]Dune: Part Two[/b] is a 2024 movie adaptation of the second half of the original [i][[dune_(series)|Dune]][/i] novel from the 60s, directed by "Denis Villeneuve":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Denis_Villeneuve. Originally scheduled for released on 3 November 2023 (after being delayed by [[coronavirus pandemic|COVID-19]]), it was pushed back due to the 2023 Writer's Guild of America and SAG-AFTRA strikes and was ultimately released on 1 March, 2024.

It is to be noted that while [[warner bros|Warner Brothers]] has not confirmed it, Denis Villeneuve has stated that he is working to adapt the second book in the series -- [i]"Dune Messiah":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dune_Messiah[/i] -- into a sequel to the duology.

h4.See also

* [[Dune (2021 movie)]]
* [[Dune (series)]]

title: misaka_imouto
body:
Identical [[clone|"Sisters"]] to [[Misaka Mikoto]] in [[ToAru Majutsu no Index|ToAru series]]. Usually have [[empty eyes]] and wear a [[night vision device]]. Whereas Mikoto has [[shorts under skirt]], Misaka Imouto only wears [[striped panties]].

Certain identifiable versions of her also have additional tags:

* [[Misaka Imouto 9982]]: she can be seen with long hair or wearing a [[Gekota]] badge on her vest
* [[Misaka Imouto 10032]]: she wears a heart-shaped necklace
* [[Misaka Imouto 10046]]: she is usually depicted wearing a nurse uniform
* [[Misaka Imouto 10777]]: she wears a typical Russian outfit, and wields an AK pattern rifle as opposed to the F2000 issued to all the others
* [[Misaka Imouto 19090]]: unlike all other Sisters, she expresses emotions

h4. See also:
* [[Dolly (Toaru Kagaku no Railgun)|Dolly]]
* [[Last Order (Toaru Majutsu no Index)|]]
* [[Misaka Imouto 10032's cat]]
* [[Misaka Worst]]

title: yunaka_(fire_emblem)
body:
A playable character from [[Fire Emblem Engage]], known for her peppy attitude and tendency to use strange phrases, such as “hiya papaya” when greeting someone, or “zappy” to express interest. She’s also the initial user of [[Micaiah (Fire Emblem)|]]’s ring after attempting to steal it.

[spoiler]Her true name is Larimar, an assassin known for her stoic, heartless demeanor. Yunaka’s “fake” personality is both an attempt to hide this dark side of her and to move on from it.[/spoiler]

She has [[long hair|long]], [[red hair]], with black and white [[star (symbol)|]] symbols on her face and hair ([[star facial mark]], [[star hair ornament]]), and wears a purple [[unitard]] with a yellow [[belt]].

Voiced by [[Fairouz Ai]] in the Japanese version (who also voiced [[Phina (Fire Emblem)|]] in the same series), and by [[Laura Post]] in the English version (who also voiced [[Silvia (Fire Emblem)|]] and [[Catherine (Fire Emblem)|]] in the same series.)

title: zock
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] from 1979.

[b]MSM-10 Zock[/b]

A colossal amphibious [[mobile suit]] developed by [[Zeon]]. 

It had an all-round symmetrical design, complete with an innovative 360 degree monoeye camera, and packed massively powerful weapons including eight mega particle cannons, but its gargantuan size meant it was both easy to hit and very slow - it relied on hover thrusters inspired by the [[Dom (mobile suit)|]] to move on land.

title: curly_fries
body:
Curly fries are [[french fries]] that spiral-shaped.  They're created by cutting the potato using a spiralisers or similar device.  They're commonly seasoned with a distinct spice mix composed primarily of paprika, black pepper, onion powder, and garlic powder.

The fast food chain [[Arby's]] is noted for selling curly fries.

title: waffle_fries
body:
Waffle fries are a type of [[french_fries|french fry]] that are lattice-shaped.  They're created by cutting the potato using a mandoline, wave slicer, or similar cutting device featuring a wavy/waffle blade.  After slicing the potato one way, the potato is quarter-turned and sliced again, thus producing the crisscross shape of the fries.

The fast food chain [[Chick-fil-A]] is noted for selling waffle fries.

title: shabon_spray
body:
[[Sailor Mercury]]'s first ability, used up until she gains [[Shine Aqua Illusion]] and [[Mercury Aqua Rhapsody]] (along with other attacks), at which point she essentially stops using this skill. She conjures some bubbles containing mist, which pop when she releases them to blanket the area in mist and reduce the temperature dramatically. It has no offensive properties, so it's designed as a defensive and strategic ability. It's actually never seen in the manga, although during the first time she transforms into Sailor Mercury, a cloud of mist surrounds the area.

[i]Shabon[/i] is an English pronunciation for [i]sabão[/i], the Portuguese word for [[soap]].

title: mercury_harp
body: The harp used by [[Super Sailor Mercury]] for her [[Mercury Aqua Rhapsody]] attack.

title: mercury_aqua_rhapsody
body: [[Super Sailor Mercury]]'s attack, seen throughout the fourth and fifth seasons of the 90s anime, and late in the manga and [[bishoujo senshi sailor moon crystal|Crystal]]. She uses the [[Mercury Harp]], strumming its strings to call upon a jet of ice water to blast at her opponent with more force than [[Shine Aqua Illusion]] does.

title: shine_aqua_illusion
body: [[Sailor Mercury]]'s second ability, and the first one to be offense-based. Small droplets drip into a pool of water before her feet, then spin around her body as a mixture of ice crystals and freezing water, growing in size until she hurls it as a concentrated wave.

title: miyamoto_rei
body:
One of the main female characters from [[Highschool of the Dead]].

She is both a childhood friend and love interest for [[Komuro Takashi]].

She has a [[long hair|long]] [[orange hair]] and [[orange eyes]] with [[large breasts]]. Her outfit consists of the [[fujimi high school uniform]] consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[serafuku]] with green accents alongside a [[black bowtie]] and [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]].

title: super_sailor_jupiter
body: The super version of [[Sailor Jupiter]]. She gains a wreath of oak leaves that she wears in her hair, which she channels for [[Jupiter Oak Evolution]]. She also still uses Sparkling Wide Pressure and [[Supreme Thunder]] as required.
other_names: スーパーセーラーヴィーナス

title: jupiter_oak_evolution
body: [[Super Sailor Jupiter]]'s attack, seen in the fourth and fifth seasons of the 90s anime, and in the manga and [[bishoujo senshi sailor moon crystal|Crystal]]. She extends the lightning rod in her tiara, then continuously spins on her toes as leaves swirl around her. She then unleashes a barrage of small green electric orbs.

title: dead_scream
body: [[Sailor Pluto]]'s first attack, and the only one she uses in the 90s anime for offense. Strong gusts of wind surround her as she raises the [[Garnet Rod]]. Unlike other characters who shout their attack names, Pluto whispers the name of Dead Scream, before gathering violet energy around the Garnet Orb, spinning around once, then firing it at the enemy.

title: skeletor
body:
A character from the [[Masters of the Universe]] franchise. He first appeared in the original cartoon from the 80s and is the main antagonist of the series.

He was voiced by Alan Oppenheimer in the first animated series and was later played by Frank Langella in the 1987 live action film adaptation of the series.

[spoiler]Skeletor was once known as [[Keldor]], the adoptive brother of [[King Randor]], absolute monarch of Eternia. While attempting to overthrow the king, a plan to murder Randor backfired on Keldor and left his face without any flesh. 

With help from [[Hordak]], Skeletor used dark magic to stay alive and thus became the hideous creature he has been to this day.

title: deep_submerge
body: [[Sailor Neptune]]'s first attack. She raises both of her hands up, gathering an aqua-colored orb of water around them before launching it at the enemy like a torpedo. When struck, the enemy is drowned in a wave of water before either being destroyed or heavily damaged.

title: world_shaking
body: [[Sailor Uranus]]' first attack. It consists of her raising her right arm up, gathering an orange ball of energy before hurling it at the enemy. When the opponent is struck, their body shakes uncontrollably before they are either destroyed or heavily damaged.

title: silence_glaive_surprise
body: An attack used by [[Sailor Saturn]], in conjunction with the [[Silence Glaive]]. Its degree of power varies with each installment, but tends to be an exceptionally strong ability capable of destroying her intended target, but will also kill Saturn in the process. In the 90s anime, there is an assumption that Saturn uses this attack against Pharaoh 90 to destroy him at the end of the third season. Officially, it is almost used once against [[Nehelenia (sailor moon)|]] in the fifth season, but [[Super Sailor Chibi Moon]] stops the attack, only leaving the castle wrecked. In the manga and [[bishoujo senshi sailor moon crystal|Crystal]], Saturn unleashes it as a projectile attack, with no danger to herself.

title: cat_luigi
body: A form of [[Luigi]] unlocked with the super bell.

title: supreme_thunder
body: [[Sailor Jupiter]]'s first attack seen in the series. This tag can also refer to the [[double \m/]] pose she performs when charging up the attack.

title: string_of_fate
body:
The red string of fate ([i]unmei no akai ito[/i], 運命の赤い糸) is an East Asian belief that every person in the world is connected to another by an invisible red string tied to little finger of the left hand. The two people connected by the red string are destined to be lovers.

It is similar to the Western concept of soulmates. The concept is popularly referenced in anime and manga. Notable examples include [[Ai Yori Aoshi]] and [[Kimagure Orange Road]], which frequently reference this concept.

h4.See also

* [[heart of string]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Red thread of fate":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_thread_of_fate

title: boku_wa_tomodachi_ga_sukunai
body:
[b]Boku wa Tomodachi ga Sukunai[/b] (僕は友達が少ない, lit. [i]I Don't Have Many Friends[/i], abbrev. [i]Haganai[/i]) is a 2009 light novel series by Hirasaka Yomi and illustrated by [[Buriki]], with a 2010 manga adaptation illustrated by Itachi and a 2011 anime adaptation by AIC Build.

The story revolves around the daily lives of the members of the Neighbor Club, a school club composed of seven socially-inept people, and their attempts to learn some social skills by engaging in various activities.

h4.Characters

* [[Hasegawa Kodaka]]
* [[Mikazuki Yozora]]
* [[Kashiwazaki Sena]]
* [[Kusunoki Yukimura]]
* [[Hasegawa Kobato]]
* [[Shiguma Rika]]
* [[Takayama Maria]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Boku wa Tomodachi ga Sukunai":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boku_wa_Tomodachi_ga_Sukunai
* "Official Light Novel Site":http://www.mediafactory.co.jp/bunkoj/rinjinbu/subtop.html
* "Official Anime Site":http://www.tbs.co.jp/anime/haganai/

title: kuma_(tekken)
body:
[[Mishima Heihachi]]'s pet [[bear]] from the [[Tekken]] series. The first Kuma died after a beatdown from [[Paul Phoenix]], while the second one is still alive and well.

Oddly enough, the second Kuma sees [[Panda (Tekken)|Panda]] as his love interest, only for the poor cub to fail in many humorous ways.

title: feo_ul
body:
Feo Ul is a non-player character from [[Final Fantasy XIV]]. They are a [[fairy|pixie]] [spoilers]with the peculiarity of seeking new objects and experiences rather than child-like fun & games[/spoilers].

[spoilers]After the previous [[titania (final fantasy)|Titania]]'s defeat they succeed to the title in place of the Warrior of Light in order to preserve his or her mortality and self.[/spoilers]

In-game, they give access to retainers while the [[warrior of light (ff14)|Warrior of Light]] is in the First.

[i]For tagging purposes this character should be tagged as an [[1other|other]] rather than [[1girl|female]] unless they are clearly depected as female.[/i]

title: titania_(final_fantasy)
body:
Titania is a non-player character in [[Final Fantasy XIV]]. The name is actually a title, bestowed upon the King of the fae tribes of Il Mheg, as such multiple depictions may exist.

[i]For tagging purposes this character should be tagged as an [[1other|other]] rather than [[1girl|female]] unless they are clearly depicted as female. 
eg. post #3404346 is genderless [[official art]], post #3675182 has cleavage and is therefore tagged as female[/i]

title: peter_parker's_glasses_(meme)
body: Peter Parker's Glasses is a multi-pane exploitable meme series in which [[Spider-Man]] alter ego [[Peter Parker]] looks at various images that drastically change as he puts his [[glasses]] on and off. It should be noted that the original scene from the 2002 Spider-Man film developed the opposite from how the meme depicts it, as Peter discovered that he can now see fine without his glasses and blurry with them on.

title: grand_narukami_shrine
body: The Grand Narukami Shrine is an area in the Inazuma region of [[Genshin Impact]], consisting of a compound of red [[east asian architecture|Japanese-style buildings]], [[torii]] gates, and many [[cherry_tree|cherry trees]].

title: shake_shake_fries
body:
[[French fries]] that are served after placing them into a bag, or other container, along with seasoning powder and shaken to coat the fries.  [[McDonald's]] is noted for these after first debuting them in Hong Kong in 2005 and then selling them in various other places in Asia and Oceania.  McDonald's has marketed these under various different names such as Shake Shake Fries, McShaker Fries, and Shakin' Flavor Fries.

This tag is not limited to only McDonald's branded fries or references, as these kinds of fries are not unique to only McDonald's.

h4. See also

* [[Shakacat]] (2024 McDonald's ad campaign for these fries in Japan)

title: cobalion
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #638 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Steel/Fighting Legendary Pokémon.
Cobalion is a quadrupedal Pokémon that possesses traits of stags and goats. It is covered in aqua blue fur, and has jagged yellow horns similar in shape to thunderbolts. Its snout is a lighter shade of blue than the rest of its fur, and there a black blaze running from its nose to the back of its head. On its long neck and hind legs, there are small gray spots. It has a white tuft of fur under its neck, resembling a cravat. On its shoulder blades are yellow protrusions that resemble fins. Its tail resembles these protrusions, albeit in the same color as its snout. Cobalion's legs have black bands with lighter fur underneath and large black hooves.

Alongside [[Terrakion]], [[Virizion]] and [[Keldeo]] it is member of the "Swords of Justice":http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Swords_of_Justice. Usually considered the leader.

It does not evolve into or from another Pokémon.
Japanese Name: [b]Cobalon[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Volcarona]]
Next Pokémon: [[Terrakion]]

title: crying_child_(fnaf)
body:
Protagonist of [[five_nights_at_freddy's_4|Five Nights at Freddy's 4]]. A crybaby child who is bullied by [[crying_child's_brother_(fnaf)|his older brother]] and is being haunted by the Nightmare Animatronics. [spoiler]Dies at the end of the game due to a prank gone wrong, his head being crushed by the animatronic who later became [[Golden Freddy]].[/spoiler]

While he doesn't have a name, [i]Sister Location[/i] heavily implies, if not outright confirms, he's an Afton and possibly related to [[elizabeth afton|Elizabeth]] and [[michael afton|Michael]]. The Fazbear Frights novels and the FNAF Logbook imply his name is Evan.

Has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] and his outfit consists of a black [[striped shirt]] and [[blue shorts]].

title: jeanne_d'arc_alter_(lancer)_(fate)
body:
A more somber and serious version of [[Jeanne d'Arc Alter (fate)|]] summoned during the Waxing Moon Ritual in [i][[Fate/Samurai Remnant]][/i]. Unlike her Avenger counterpart, she dual-wields [[lance|lances]] and wears a tattered purple [[cape]].

[spoilers]She is actually the corrupted form of the real [[Jeanne d'Arc (fate)|]], so wished into this state by her master [[Chiemon (fate)|]]'s intense desire to wreak vengance upon the Tokugawa Shogunate overpowering her immunity to corruption. As a result, many of the advantages she would have in a typical Holy Grail War have been severely reduced.[/spoilers]

title: eizen_(tales)
body:
[[Tales of Berseria]] character. [[edna (tales)|Edna]]'s older brother. He is a pirate who commandeers the Van Eltia in order to find his missing captain Aifread. He is notorious for being cursed with misfortune, earning him the moniker 'The Grim Reaper'. His seiyuu is [[Morikawa Toshiyuki]], who also replaced Shiozawa Kaneto as [[Dhaos (Tales)|Dhaos]]' seiyuu for [[Tales of Phantasia]].

In [[Tales of Zestiria]], which takes place 1,000 years later, his exposure to malevolence had already caused him to turn into a mindless and ferocious [[eizen_(dragon)_(tales)|dragon]]. Edna travels with the party so that she may find a way to restore him.

h4.Costume Titles

title: mds-02_geist
body:
[b]MDS-02 "Most Dangerous Soldier" Geist[/b] is the main character of the 1986 OVA [[M.D. Geist]]. A super-soldier developed by the Earth military forces on the planet Jerra, he was deemed too dangerous and was put into stasis inside an orbital prison. Years later the prison crashes and Geist walks free once again to engage in another war.

Geist is an MDS, a genetically engineered human with unsurpassed combat skills and bloodlust. He also has no morals and no concern for anyone or adherence to anything except for the mission he has been given. Because he can't stop, he's just a soldier.

Frequently depicted with the suit of armor he wears in the finale of the OVA.

title: howto:named_outfits
body:
h4.This wiki is still a WIP, and its ruleset hasn't been applied yet. See topic #17377 for the relevant discussion.

[expand=Table of Contents]
* 1 "Terminology":#dtext-term
* 2 "Danbooru’s Tagging Guidelines":#dtext-guidelines
** 2.01 "Default + One Variant":#dtext-onevariant
** 2.02 "One Costume For Multiple Characters":#dtext-onecosmultichara
** 2.03 "Cosplay":#dtext-cosplay
** 2.04 "Characters From Existing Copyrights":#dtext-existing
* 3 "List of Gacha Games":#dtext-gamelist
[/expand]

This is a guide on how to tag characters and their alternate outfits that appear in gacha-styled mobile games.

Throughout recent years, there lacked a means of standardizing how alternate costumes for characters in gacha games should be tagged on Danbooru. The conventions that work for one title may not work so well for another, which then leads to inconsistencies and confusion. The aim is to define why there is a difference between video game media and other forms of media when it comes to handling characters and named outfits, and then use already-existing tagging conventions and examples to clarify things. This process can then be standardized so that what works for one gacha game can work for another, rather than users making up unique rules on a game-to-game basis that will wind up conflicting with each other.

As discussed in the forums however, [[Fate/Grand Order]] has been separated into its own discussion due to the unique circumstances surrounding how it releases characters and alternate outfits. This article has deliberately excluded any examples from that game for this purpose. Please go to topic #17356 ("The Fate/Grand Retagging Project") if you wish to discuss tagging conventions for F/GO specifically.

h4#term. TERMINOLOGY

[i]Gacha[/i] (ガチャ) is shorthand for [i]gachapon[/i] (ガチャポン), which in itself is an alternate saying of [[gashapon]] (ガシャポン). Whatever the reading, this is a type of Japanese-produced vending machine that customers dispense money into, then they twist a crank and the machine dispenses a plastic egg containing a randomly-selected toy or prize. Usually this is one toy out of a collectible set, incentivizing customers to pay more to complete the collection. [i]Gasha/gacha[/i] is the Japanese onomatopoeia for the sound of the crank being twisted, while [i]pon[/i] is the sound of the toy dropping into the receptacle.

Similarly, a gacha video game is a branch of mobile gaming where players save up a fictional in-game currency, then use it to [i]roll[/i] the virtual vending machine (think of spinning a slot machine or roulette wheel). What players roll for tend to be desired characters, character classes, weapons, vehicles, materials, add-ons or whatnot. The majority of this discussion is going to cover characters and named outfits, since Danbooru is a character-based imageboard.

h4#guidelines. DANBOORU’S TAGGING GUIDELINES

Due to the complex nature of gacha games and how they release characters, alternate costumes, and/or alternate forms, Danbooru’s guidelines for separating everything with tags work somewhat differently from non-gacha titles. Make note that these conventions are not exclusive to gacha games - console games and MMORPGs also use similar systems for releasing characters and alternate forms/outfits. This article primarily focuses on gacha games because the bulk of new releases tend to originate from there, but it is not a concept exclusive to gachas. Regardless of what game type is being dealt with, there are some categories to go over with how these are treated here.

The crux of this article comes from when an already-released character is recycled and given a different costume. This then complicates tagging these alternate costumes because while they literally are the same character just wearing a different outfit, the game itself treats them as an entirely different character by giving that costume an official name. Compounding things is that these characters may possess different skill sets, character classes, and/or be categorized according to an in-game ID number, further proving that the developers intended for these alternate costumes to be treated as full characters.

That last sentence is especially important for Danbooru’s purposes, particularly the phrase, [b]"Alternate costumes to be treated as full characters".[/b] When it comes to video games, that is how a [i]named outfit[/i] should be treated here – with a character tag, not just treating it as the same character wearing a different outfit. For Danbooru’s purposes, this is called a [i]variant[/i]. Other terms that can be used interchangeably are [i]forms[/i], [i]versions[/i], and [i]alternate costumes[/i], but this article will stick to the term [i]variant[/i] for consistency's sake.
 
This has been a growing source of confusion in the last few years for one reason: [b]Most forms of media don't name their alternate outfits.[/b] For a non-video game example, [[Yoko Littner]]'s swimsuit (post #178763) that she wears in a single episode of [[Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann]] doesn't have an official name attached to it; it's just a swimsuit. Another example is [[Tomoe Hotaru]]'s black dress (post #2227732) that she frequently wears in [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]]. The creators never assigned a name to it; it's just a dress she wears. Therefore, regardless if the costume comes from an anime, video game, movie, book, or other form of media, if the creators/developers don't give a name to an alternate outfit, then don't give it one here.

[i]Further discussion is needed regarding an outfit that was initially released without a name, then retroactively given a name later in the franchise's life, and whether or not it should be likewise retroactively tagged with a new character tag. While this is uncommon, it does happen.
- Benit149[/i]

In contrast, a gacha example would be [[Azur Lane]]'s [[Sirius (azur lane)|]], who has a swimsuit that is officially named [[sirius (scorching-hot seirios) (azur lane)|Scorching-Hot Seirios]]. This means that it should be given the same treatment here by denoting a character tag (or [i]chartag[/i]) to it.

[b]That is the primary difference between tagging characters and outfits from gacha games and those from non-gacha titles.[/b] Official sources will name a character's alternate outfit, and Danbooru users then tag according to whatever conventions the official sources use.

h6#onevariant. DEFAULT + ONE VARIANT

Using the Sirius example mentioned above, the variant of her that was released first in Azur Lane is considered to be her [i]default variant[/i], or just [i]default[/i]. The default's tag would be:

* [[sirius_(azur_lane)]]

Danbooru already has a tagging system that pairs character names with the copyright as a qualifier, separating them from a character with the same name in a different copyright (called [i]disambiguator[/i] here). Later in the game's life, the aforementioned swimsuit variant is released. This would be her [i]holiday variant[/i]. By this, this refers to limited-time variants who are only available during a specific period of the year, and their character designs will often reflect this. The three most popular holidays are Summer (or 'Swimsuit' variants), Halloween, and Christmas. Some gacha games may incorporate other holidays like Valentines or Easter for character design purposes. Another catchall term that can be used is [i]special variant[/i] if there is no holiday attached to the costume.

To facilitate this, a new chartag is created:

* [[sirius (scorching-hot seirios) (azur lane)|]]

The original sirius_(azur_lane) chartag is also added to function as an umbrella tag, compiling any and every post of Sirius regardless of variants. If a user then wanted to exclude Midsummer Seirios from a search and just look up Sirius' default variant, they can then do a {{sirius_(azur_lane) -sirius_(midsummer_seirios)_(azur_lane)}} search. The naming convention for a holiday/special variant's chartag would be:

* character_(holiday/special_variant)_(copyright)

Another way that named outfits are released is through a character [i]skin[/i]. In gaming terms, this is an alternate costume that only serves to function as a cosmetic change for a character, without changing the character's in-game functionality. Contrast this to [i]variant[/i], where a character's outfit [u]and[/u] in-game functionality change. So long as the skin has been given an official name, the same tagging convention for a holiday/special variant can also work for a skin.

[i]There is some debate as to whether or not the default should get the same treatment as the holiday variant for consistency’s sake, or if it’s best to just leave them as is. At the moment, the default is left as-is.
- Benit149[/i]

Another way generally involves standardized names based on a gacha game's upgrade routes. Though previously rendered as general tags (or [i]gentags[/i]), covering multiple characters with one standard tag, they have since been split up to individually cover characters. Generally, these designate a character who wears a new costume when they reach their final upgrade, but several gacha games employ unique costumes for each upgrade level. Examples of either/or include [[Kantai Collection]], which has [[Remodel (kantai collection)|]]s, [[Warship Girls R]] and its [[Remodel (warship girls r)|]]s, [[Azur Lane]] and its [[Retrofit (azur lane)|]]s, [[Girls' Frontline]] and its [[MOD3 (girls' frontline)|]]s, [[Touken Ranbu]] and its [[Kiwame (touken ranbu)|]], and more. These should follow the above-presented format, but the middle brackets having the shared upgrade route.

h6#onecosmultichara. ONE COSTUME FOR MULTIPLE CHARACTERS

As implied earlier, sometimes there is a singular tag that will cover multiple characters with one brush stroke. However, while the above accounted several different types of costumes under one shared concept, traditionally this would imply a shared alternate costume, like uniforms.

As an example, [[Idolmaster]] has named thematic outfits that multiple characters of a band will wear as a sort of uniform (barring minor design changes per character), like [[Cute & Girly (idolmaster)|]], [[Sailor Swimsuit (idolmaster)|]], or [[Cool & Sexy (idolmaster)|]].

At the moment, this is the only category that uses gentags rather than specific chartags. 

[i]More discussion is needed as to whether or not it is desirable to leave it like this or to expand them as chartags. The crux of the argument is that gentags wind up getting 'lost' in the quagmire of dozens of other gentags describing everything in an image, while making chartags for every instance is far too cumbersome and pedantic.
- Benit149[/i]

h6#cosplay. COSPLAY

Use the default variant's chartag when dealing with any and all *_(cosplay) tags:

* character_(copyright)_(cosplay)

If you are uploading a cosplay of a holiday/special variant, then tag it like this:

* character1_(copyright) [i](chartag)[/i]
** character1_(copyright)_(cosplay) [i](gentag)[/i]
** character1_(holiday/special_variant)_(copyright) [i](chartag)[/i]
* character2_(copyright) [i](chartag)[/i]

h6#existing. CHARACTERS FROM EXISTING COPYRIGHTS

As stated in the introduction, characters who already exist in previous forms of media are transferred into gacha games as prizes to be rolled for. Does this mean existing characters have to be renamed to fit with them being in a gacha game?

The simple answer is, no. Stick to the chartags that already exist, and use the gacha's copyright tag only if an image is applicable to the gacha game, like a gacha-exclusive named costume for a character.

Gacha games still have a copyright tag because original characters and/or concepts unique to the game will pop up, which means that the copyright tag has to function as their origin. With [[Wild Arms: Million Memories]], we have [[Brittany Shrewsbury]]; for [[Tales of the Rays]], we have [[Ix Nieves]] and [[Mileena Weiss]]; for [[Star Ocean Anamnesis]], we have [[evelysse (star ocean)|Evelysse]]; for the [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden|Madoka Magica]] game, we have [[Tamaki Iroha]], [[Futaba Sana]], [[Yui Tsuruno]] and others. So on and so forth.

Likewise, [[official art]] of existing characters can fall under the gacha's copyright since that's where it's being marketed.

H4#gamelist. LIST OF GAMES WITH NAMED OUTFITS

Let's get into the games that these guidelines are applicable to. Some of them are mobile spin-offs of existing copyrights, while others are wholly original titles. Regardless if the game is active or defunct, they will go here. The titles will be listed in alphabetical order.

To reiterate, [[Fate/Grand Order]] has been excluded from this article entirely, and thus from this list as well.

[b]This is an ongoing work-in-progress. Any contributions made will be greatly appreciated.[/b]

* [[Another Eden]]
* [[Apex Legends]]
* [[Arknights]]
* [[Azur Lane]]
* [[Blue Archive]]

title: mochi_(touhou)
body:
The living mochi with a face (we think) that appears on the title screen of [[Touhou]] 15: [[Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom]]. It appears nowhere else and is never mentioned [s]again[/s] even once, the one major stretch of an exception being the LoLK difficulty selections, which are all captioned with degrees of mochi firmness.

Despite this, or even perhaps because of this, it has become a minor fandom meme. Fans think it's a mochi with a face, but there is no unanimous consensus, so its name is sometimes a variation of "Mochi...?"

Fans seem to enjoy giving it cameos in unexpected places, especially where it goes unnoticed by every character in the picture. Its exact smiling face design would later appear in [[Touhou LostWord]] on the common Phantom enemies.

body:

Note that this tag is for any depiction of chewing gum. Be it in a packet, wrapper, strip, being chewed upon or stuck to someone's shoe.
If a person is blowing bubbles with the chewing gum, then also add the [[blowing bubbles]] tag.

title: bubble
body:
Usually refers to a soap bubble, which is a very thin film of soapy water that forms a sphere with an iridescent surface. However, this term can also applied to any type of bubble, including [[chewing gum]] and [[air_bubble|air bubbles]] [[underwater]].

h4. See also

* [[blowing bubbles]]
* [[bubble wand]]
* [[bubble pipe]]

title: blowing_bubbles
body:
The act of doing one of three things: 

* Blowing a soap bubble through a [[bubble pipe]], [[bubble wand]] or similar tool.
* Blowing into a piece of [[chewing gum]] to create a bubble in front of the mouth.
* Exhaling air while [[underwater]] to create bubbles.

title: nappa
body:
The second [[Dragon Ball Z]] villain in the series.

He is a [[bald]] [[muscular]] Saiyan with a [[mustache]] shaped like a sharp arch. He is the [[manly|manliest]] of all Saiyans.

He wears [[Frieza]]'s traditional Saiyan [[armor]] with dark blue body plates and gold shoulder plates. He wears metallic gauntlets and boots that share the same color as his armor. He has an ape tail meaning that he can transform into a [[Oozaru|Great Ape]] with the help of the Power Ball (an [[energy ball]] in the shape of a [[full moon]]). He wears a [[scouter]] on his left eye, as per the tradition of Frieza's henchmen.

He eventually removes his scouter and armor, respectively, as the series goes on. He killed [[Son Gohan|Gohan]] and brutalized him, which eventually put [[Son Goku|Goku]] into rage. When he goes to question fellow Saiyan [[Vegeta]] about Goku's power level, Vegeta states that it's [[it's over 9000 (meme)|]], much to his surprise.

He is a loyal servant to Vegeta, until he was trashed for his weakness as a sign of betrayal.

title: scouter
body:
A small, single-lens eyepiece originated from [[Dragon Ball Z]] that is worn wrapped around the side of the head. The device typically sports a [[heads-up display]] that provides its wearer with statistics or information on their surroundings, similar to a [[head-mounted display]]. Its most well-known feature, however, is its ability to calculate the power level of any living being, and displayed the result as a number.

Not to be confused with the [[monocle]], another single-lens eyepiece used expressly for correcting vision like [[glasses]].

h4. See also
* [[It's over 9000 (meme)|]]

title: pinkfong
body:
A South Korean music creator focused in children's songs. Its logo is a pink fox with a crown.

Their most famous song is "[[Baby Shark (song)|]]", which is the most viewed video on YouTube.

title: baby_shark_(song)
body:
A children's song about a family of [[shark]]s out on a hunt, composed of a little shark, its parents, and two of its grandparents, a grandfather and a grandmother.

Already popular as a campfire song, it exploded into further popularity when a video version of the song by Korean company [[Pinkfong]] was uploaded to Youtube in 2015 and became the most watched video in the site in 2021, eventually emerging as the first video to have 10 billion views in January 2022. The said video and its accompanying dance video also spawned a dance craze which started in Southeast Asia and eventually spread to East Asia and later the West around 2018. Japan is a relative late bloomer to this craze thanks to a cover by Uehara Risa released in 2020. Pinkfong subsequently released a Japanese version of the video later in the year.

The original English lyrics merely lists each family member. The Korean lyrics and later the Japanese ones as released by Pinkfong expand on this by describing each member.

h4. External Links
* "Youtube: Baby Shark Dance (by Pinkfong)":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XqZsoesa55w]
* "Youtube: Baby Shark Dance (Uehara Risa's cover)":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6nmF9KxxWPw]
* "Youtube: Baby Shark Japanse version (by Pinkfong)":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O3l1SW6sctw]
* "English Wikipedia - Baby Shark":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baby_Shark]
* "Japanese Wikipedia - サメのかぞく":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%82%B5%E3%83%A1%E3%81%AE%E3%81%8B%E3%81%9E%E3%81%8F]

body:
An [[undead]] [[wizard|sorcerer]] often with a [[skeleton|skeletal]] or [[corpse|cadaverous]] appearance. A staple of the sword-and-sorcery genre of [[fantasy]] fiction.

Unlike mindless [[zombie|zombies]], liches tend to be highly intelligent and are capable of using [[magic]]. They are frequently clad in armor or fine clothing reminiscent of wizards or kings.

title: yagyu_(senran_kagura)
body:
[[Senran Kagura]] character. A first-year Shinobi at the Hanzou Academy. She is the second youngest in the group after [[Hibari (senran kagura)|]].

Yagyuu has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] tied into [[twintails]] with [[shuriken]]. After transforming into a Shinobi, she wears a brown suit [[jacket]] over a [[white shirt]] and [[red [necktie]]. She wears a [[red skirt|red]] [[plaid skirt]] and calf-high [[socks]]. Yagyuu also wears a black mantle. She is often seen carrying around her [[umbrella]]. She always wears an [[eyepatch]] over her right eye.

When her clothes are ripped off, she is revealed to be wearing a [[frilled bikini|frilled]] [[pink bikini]].

Her seiyuu is [[Mizuhashi Kaori]].
