title: bing_chilling_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originating from a video of [[John Cena]] sitting in a car, talking in [[Chinese text|Chinese]] about having an [[ice cream cone]] and promoting his film [[fast & furious|Fast & Furious 9]]. Parodies with fake subtitles soon emerged, sometimes coupled with other videos about him praising [[Lao Gan Ma]] chili or the apology video after he "accidentally" referred to [[Taiwan]] as a country.

The name of the meme comes from his weird pronunciation of ice cream (冰淇淋/bing qi lin), which he repeats multiple times through the video.

Along with Chinese eggman, [[tom_chin_cheng_hanji_(meme)|Chinese Tom]], and [[social_credit_score_(meme)|social credits]], these memes were a part of the "Chinese meme" that became prevalent in 2021, typically in a derisive context towards [[China|the Chinese Communist government]].

h4. External link

* "Know Your Meme article":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/john-cena-speaking-chinese-and-eating-ice-cream-bing-chilling]

title: john_cena
body:
American professional wrestler, currently working for [[WWE]], where he serves as the franchise player of the company.

Real name: [b]John Felix Anthony Cena Jr.[/b]

h4. Known moves

body:
A customizable player character from the [[Splatoon_(series)|]] series. The player can choose between an [[Inkling Boy]] or [[Inkling Girl]].

This tag is for the Inklings that serve as the player's character, and for squid form Inklings (post #2028621). Do not use it for named characters such as [[Callie_(splatoon)|]] or [[Marie_(splatoon)|]].

[b]See [[Inkling]] (species) Wiki for a list of named Inklings (e.g. the Idols) and a section on how to differentiate between Inklings and [[Octoling]]s.[/b]

Remember to tag the general species tag for Inkling player characters as well as named characters such as the Idols or any OCs. With the exception being an Inkling as an [[alternate species]] (e.g. them being depicted as a human / [[humanization]]).

title: gm_cannon
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. 

[b]RGC-80 GM Cannon[/b]

A support variant of the [[gm_(mobile_suit)|GM]] [[mobile suit]] equipped with a powerful 240mm [[cannon]] on its right shoulder. Even though it was a different machine in its appearance, it shared 60% of its parts with the general-purpose GM, and could load all of the versatile platform's weapons.

Evolved into the [[GM Cannon II]].

title: defender_(macross)
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Macross]] series. It first appeared in [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV anime series from 1982.

The [b]Viggers/Chrauler ADR-04-Mk X Defender[/b] [[destroid]] is an anti-[[aircraft]] defense robot system (mecha) created by the [[U.N. Spacy]] to fight the [[Zentradi]].

Designed for anti-aircraft operations in mind, the Defender featured two heavy and very potent double barrel automatic cannons for arms. The mecha also has two large ammunition drums (often mistaken for [[missile pod]]s) mounted on top of its main chassis.

The Defender was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the early 80s.

It was initially used as the [[Rifleman (battletech)|]] in the [[BattleTech]] [[board game]] franchise during the eighties.

title: amx-30
body: French first generation [[Main Battle Tank]]. Trading away heavy armor for mobility and firepower, the AMX-30 packed the 105mm F1 indigenously designed gun (unlike other Western MBTs of the era, which all used a variation of the 105mm L7 gun) as well as a 20mm autocannon coaxially, giving it excellent offensive capabilities. The type was substantially updated until it was eventually replaced in French service by the Leclerc.

title: splatoon_3
body:
Third installment of [i][[Splatoon (series)|]][/i], released in 2022 for the [[Nintendo Switch]].

The game launched with four gameplay modes, those being: [b]Turf War[/b], a multiplayer mode playing similar to Regular Battles in previous games; [b]Anarchy Battle[/b], a multiplayer mode playing similar to Ranked Battles in [[Splatoon 2]] with a group of rotating game styles; [[Salmon Run (splatoon)|Salmon Run: Next Wave]], an updated version of the co-op mode introduced in Splatoon 2; and [b]Return of the Mammalians[/b], a single-player campaign focusing on the new [[Squidbeak Splatoon]] member [b][[Agent 3 (Splatoon 3)|]][/b] as they deal with the onset of Fuzzy Ooze, a substance that bestows mammalian traits onto creatures that touch it. After launch, a fifth mode was added as DLC making up "Wave 2" of the Expansion Pass, [b][[Splatoon 3: Side Order|Side Order]][/b], a single-player campaign focusing on [b][[Agent 8 (Splatoon)|]][/b], returning from [[Splatoon 2: Octo Expansion|Octo Expansion]], as they take on a mysterious tower called the Spire of Order.

Other features include [[Splashtag (splatoon)|]]s and {{Splatoon_3 locker|customizable lockers}}.

h4. Characters (WIP)

[tn]See [[Splatoon 3: Side Order|Side Order]] wiki for the list of characters in the expansion. See [[Jelleton]] wiki for the list of Jelleton enemies that appear in the expansion.[/tn]

title: turing_(neural_cloud)
body:
Codenamed "Turing" is a female AI character from the game [[Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud]].  She is an agent (AI) developed by 42Lab to administrate their AI development sector "Rossum."  She's initially a non-playable character, but was added to the roster of playable characters with the Critical Cascade story event.

Her research lead to the creation of the AI agent [[Hannah (Neural Cloud)|]], who she treated like a daughter [spoiler]until her reset and loss of memories of the past[/spoiler].

A "language" spoken by characters in the [[Animal Crossing]] series. A sort of semi-intelligible text-to-speech in which each character/letter is represented by one sound. Animalese can appear differently depending on the game in the series it appears in.

title: busujima_saeko
body:
The main female character of [[Highschool of the Dead]]. Uses a [[bokken]] and later a [[katana]] to smash zombies with.

Her [[large breasts]] can bounce faster than the speed of sound. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] and [[blue eyes]] alongside [[large breasts]]. Her outfit consists of the [[fujimi high school uniform]] consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[serafuku]] with green accents alongside a [[black bowtie]] and [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]]. Originally, she wore a [[long skirt]] although she is seen later on wearing a shorter skirt with [[black thighhighs]] and [[garter straps]].

While the smallest of the 4 girls, her tendency not to wear much causes her bust to get emphasized in the anime and exaggerated in fanart. Due to wearing an [[apron]] and [[thong]] she also is famous for her sizable [[ass]], occasionally reaching [[huge ass]] sizes ([tn]See post #801899.[/tn]).

title: maresato_alice
body:
Supporting character from [[Highschool of the Dead]].

She is a young girl who was rescued by [[Komuro Takashi]]. She is often seen with a puppy named Zeke. [spoiler]Her father was murdered in front of her by a paranoid survivor when they were attempting to find a shelter out of desperation.[/spoiler]

She is a young girl with [[medium hair|medium]] [[pink hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a [[white jacket]] and [[pink dress]].

title: takagi_saya
body:
Supporting character from [[Highschool of the Dead]].

She is the daughter of a prominent politician and the smartest among the group, making her the brains. She is also a childhood friend of [[Komuro Takashi]].

She has [[pink hair|pink]] [[long hair]] usually tied in a [[twintails]] and [[yellow eyes]] along with [[large breasts]]. Her outfit consists of the [[fujimi high school uniform]] consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[serafuku]] with green accents alongside a [[black bowtie]] and [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]].

title: marikawa_shizuka
body:
Supporting character from [[Highschool of the Dead]].

She is the school nurse of the Fujimi Academy and so far, the only adult in the group.

She has a [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[yellow eyes]] along with [[huge breasts]]. Her outfit consists of a [[white shirt]], a pair of [[white gloves]] and [[long skirt|long]] [[black skirt]].

He is a second year student from Fujimi Academy and the love interest for [[Miyamoto Rei]].

He is a tall young man with [[black hair|black]] [[spiked hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. His outfit is a [[Fujimi high school uniform]] consisting of a [[gakuran]] and [[black pants]].

title: kaifuku_jutsushi_no_yarinaoshi_~sokushi_mahou_to_skill_copy_no_chouetsu_heal~
body:
[b]Kaifuku Jutsushi no Yarinaoshi[/b] (EN: [b]Redo of Healer[/b])  is a dark fantasy light novel series written by Tsukiyo Rui (月夜涙) and illustrated by [[Shiokonbu]] that has been published since 2017. A TV anime adaptation was produced by TNK and aired in 2021.

The series (especially anime adaptation) became controversial due to amount of sexual content featured and a plot which revolves around [[rape]] and torture.

Although widely panned by critics and aboard viewership for poor story and theme, the anime's release topped the chart of Japanese anime viewership in early 2021, and the first episode of anime (illegally) uploaded to China's [[Bilibili]] received over 1 million views in 24 hours.

Due to the backlash, the anime was banned from mainstream network in Japan after episode 3, and China after the first episode, results into it being a commercial failure.

h4. Main Characters

* [[Freiya (kaiyari)|]]
* [[Setsuna (kaiyari)|]]
* [[Keyarga (kaiyari)|]]
* [[Eve (kaiyari)|]]
* [[Kureha Krylet]]
* [[Gulen (kaiyari)|]]

h4. Characters - Villains

* [[Flare Earlgrande Gioral]]
* [[Irene (kaiyari)|]]
* [[Bullet (kaiyari)|]]

h4. External links

title: kimitachi_wa_dou_ikiru_ka
body:
A Japanese animated film directed by [[Miyazaki Hayao]], and animated by [[Studio Ghibli]]. The film is named after the 1937 book of the same name, written by Yoshino Genzaburo, but not based on it. Beginning production in July 2016, the film was originally anticipated for release before the original dates of the [[2020 Summer Olympics]], but even by August 2018, Studio Ghibli had already shifted their expectations ahead to 2021 or 2022. In December 2022, Studio Ghibli announced a release date of July 14, 2023, with the theatrical poster being the only piece of promotion, leading to artists making parodying fanarts of the Heron.

Later won the [[The Academy Awards|Oscar]] Best Animated Feature in 2024, 21 years after [[Sen to Chihiro no Kamikakushi]] achieved the same feat.
